title: Another Bridge
review: Yes that's right, it's a bridge. A suspension bridge. A suspension bridge that goes from one side of the Ganges river to the other. Yip, it's s bridge.

title: Great View from A Narrow Suspension Bridge
review: Very important and ancient suspension bridge to cross river Ganga afoot. Motor-Bikes, scooters and pedal rickshaws are permitted to use this extremely narrow bridge, making it a nightmare for pedestrians to walk along. A ferry service available at the foot of the bridge is cheap, speedy and comfortable. The view of the grand and pious river Ganga from Raam Jhula is worth all the trouble to cross on the bridge. Very old and Important Ashrams and Temples are located on one side and Rishikesh city, some commercial establishments, Sivananda Hospital and few important Ashrams like Sivananda Ashram are all located on the other side; hence the traffic crossing across the river is ever increasing.

title: Love it awesome place
review: I like this jhula of the Rishikesh which you have come once in a year and see the many people moving here and there with full enjoyment and it's family very happy.

title: Sit by the Ganga
review: Sit on the ghat, enjoy the breeze, look at the waters flowing swiftly by and just chill. You will feel a sense of serenity automatically descending on you. It's a wonderful feeling. You can also take a boat ride across the river and walk down to the Mahesh Yogi ashram where the Beatles stayed for a few weeks. That's also quite an experience.

title: A swinging affair
review: A pleasant experience. The walk on the bridge flanked by the Holy waters on both sides and the scenic view is breathtaking.

title: Worth a visit
review: There is very little to do around the bridge, which itself is a relatively modern "suspended bridge" construction, built and maintained by the Government.

title: Vacation time
review: Awesome Place for peace of mind. Every evening you can watch and take part in famous Ganga Aarti. You can relax on the banks of Ganga and take a dip in it. Must visit place of everyone. Ram Jhula is an iron suspension bridge across the river Ganga. There are many ashrams and religious centers established at both sides of the Ganges to pray and stay for pilgrims visiting the place.

title: Very good location
review: The place is very beautiful & very lovely there is so many  places to visit and see many things .

title: Wonderful
review: Ram jhula is a sort of landmark of Rishikesh and is used as a proverbial location map for ashramas , great views and temples . It's a cantilever bridge separating the two banks of Ganga river. The views in the evening with lights is worth every penny . Great views of the beautiful Ganga can be seen from this historic vantage point . Mostly crowded at any point of time of the day

title: Awesome
review: An awesome visit to Laxman Zhoola to cross the Ganges to visit temples on other side such as Geeta Bhawan or any Ashram.

title: nice walk around
review: Built in 1980, Ram Jhula is one of the only two bridges that cross Ganga in Rishkesh. On both the sides of the bridge are various temples as well as Ashram. You can have a peaceful walk around the both areas, have coffee, enjoy the view.

title: Inspiring
review: I loved crossing this iconic bridge daily.

title: Beautiful Views of Ganga and both banks
review: Visited Feb 5 and 6. Beautiful views of the Ganga.  Interesting experince- motor scooters, tourists, locals, monkeys. Lots of stalls with shopping on either side.  Great experience.

title: Love the monkey gangs and Gangha
review: Only in India would the backdrop of the Himalayan foothills and Ganga river be in full contrast with the cute yet aggressive local, urban conditioned monkeys.

title: Ram Jhula
review: This is again an experience one can only experience. Its one of the most visited place in the whole rishikesh area, and it lives upto the reputation.

title: Love the view and the local vibes!
review: Ram Jhula was painted the color of India’s national flag which makes it look stunning. The bridge is actually very small so you should be mindful of motorbikes passing by anytime. You will see local crowds there, it’s a great place to observe local’s life. And the souvenir shops around the area have nicer design and varieties. Good place to chill by the holy Ganga river, immerse yourself in the local crowds and shopping for souvenirs. Love it very much!

title: A slice of real India on a suspension bridge
review: Just Like Laxmanjhula, Ramjhula is also synonymous with Rishikesh. A hanging foot bridge over river Ganga, it gets pretty crowded during the busy time, with pedestrian, two wheelers and the omnipresent holy Cows!!

title: One of the two bridges in Rishikesh
review: Definitely a must do. It’s very beautiful at night. All lit up and you can see Parmarth Niketan all lit up as well at night from the bridge. There are rows of shops once you cross the bridge.

title: Hanging bridge and identity of Rishikesh
review: Rishikesh identity also comes with 2 hanging bridges - Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula. When someone in local says Rishikesh, it relates to Ram Jhula and the place near Laxman Jhula is called Tapovan. During daylight, Ram Jhula is very crowded and took time to cross. Taking photographs amidst the crowd is also a challenge. But, the green coloured Ganges flowing beneath makes it most pleasant to see from a height. At Ram Jhula, we walked across the the Ghat side - Ramjhola Ganga Ghat and spent 5-10 minutes.

title: Hanging Bridge offering great views
review: Beautiful and delightful. Amazing views on offer. 2 wheelers of all kinds on the bridge along with tourists and locals. Well made ghats around both banks of the Ganges. During the night its well lit and looks well as well. Definitely a must visit in Rishikesh.

title: Importance of Ram Jhoola
review: Previously there was only Laxman jhoola for connectivity between Rishikesh & Swargashram. For Swargashram area it is nearly two km walk from one end to another end. Another end is famous with Parmarth Nikaten & Geeta bhawan. Mostly people visits these places for Yoga n spiritual vicinity. Later government made Ram jhoola to make easy access to another end. Before bridge people using big motor boat to cross Ganga river.

title: Great experience
review: Always a pleasure to walk over this... Try walking around when the water level is low you will be amazed by looking at the size and numbers of fishes eating food in running water.. It is a treat for eyes along with blast of fresh air.

title: Beautiful Bridge connecting the banks of Ganges
review: This is a lovely place to visit and see the Ganges gushing below. This bridge is less crowded than Lakshman Jhoola and is a lot more serene and quiet.

title: Beautiful bridge
review: Well constructed bridge and you can enjoy the Ganga flowing in its voracious speed. It's get crowded with two wheels.ita very narrow to walk.

title: Nice Bridge across Ganga river
review: Nice Bridge across Ganga river.... looks very good with lighting in the evening. They allow 2 wheelers in this small bridge, some time it creates jam and inconvenience.

title: Great Location
review: Try a 360 degree view when you are river rafting in the serene Ganga Ji. Amidst mountains this is a fabulous point.

title: Similar to lakshman jhula
review: Ram jhula name is less famous than lakshman jhula but it has the same experience with mythological story of god ram and lakshman.

title: The most crazy suspension bridge Ive ever crossed!
review: The views from this bridge are amazing but sometimes crossing it isnt the easiest feat! You have to dodge other people, motorbikes, selfie takers, monkeys and cows crossing! We crossed the bridge several times in our three days in Rishikesh and once looked on from a temple where the foot traffic came to a congested stand still for about half and hour.

title: Its so beautiful, you can even cross it using 2 wheeler.
review: Its well constructed, on the river Ganges, One can stand here and see the mesmerizing view of flowing Ganges.

title: Average
review: This bridge is almost a look alike of Lakshman Jhula however Lakshman Jhula is way better than this and you can understand the difderence by visiting.

title: Nice view of Ganges and very
review: Ram Jhula is a nice walk in Rishikesh. You get the excellent view of ganges and can walk to Geetha Bavan. Taste the crispy Jalebi in Geetha bavan

title: This is one amazing hanging bridge
review: It is a man-made bridge. It swings slightly due to the wind, you can feel it when passing through the bridge. The bridge looks spectacular and the surrounding view is also great. Other than this there is a temple and ashram. If you are visiting the temples and ashram be sure to take a good guide.

title: The place is wonderful
review: The place is really peaceful. It can be enjoyed all year around. Must visit if you are going there with family

title: Majestic & Inspiring
review: Firstly the view from Sivanand Ashram is majestic and when you concentrate and observe silently and peacefully, it inspires you to follow a journey of evolving, from a stage of material and intelligence quotient, stepping into emotional Quotient and finally striving for Spiritual Excellence.. I could just sit on top at Govardhan Dham and ascend into discovering my inner and higher Self

title: Good place...
review: Good view of sun rise... one can get a ride across the Ganges via ferry from Ram Jula... Ganges is really very beautiful & clean here, as well as deep... Ram Jula is much older than Lakshman Jula... it was built in 1930s... but properly kept & maintained... only problem is the allowance of 2 wheelers & other vehicles through this bridge, which interferes with  one's enjoyment of beauty of the Ganges & surrounding mountains...

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Peaceful Place numrouse visitor do visit here everyday. One of must visit place because maximum tourists attraction is either this side of the bridge either other side.

title: cleaner gangaji
review: this is most visited place in rishikesh. i loved the banks of gangaji. whole view of ram jhula was good.

title: Sense of Freedom
review: I enjoy slow walking at this area. Everyone greeting everyone, nice cafeteria and foods in this area, books shop and many others stuff . The sunset is beautiful and sitting beside the mystical Ganga river that is no words can express the feelings of the moment of peacefulness.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Situated nearby lakshman jhula, this bridge is bigger when compared with the lakshman jhula. Looks amazing when lit up in the night.

title: Bridge over the Ganges
review: Truly remarkable engineering of this bridge that is always busy. Motor bikes jostle for space to try to cross the bridge to get accross the river. We chose to go accross by boat and walked back over the bridge, and stopped to take in the awe of Mother Ganga from the bridge.

title: A walk on the bridge
review: Ram Jhula is situated next to the Sivananda ashram in Rishikesh. Before walking across to the other end it is a good idea to gaze at the serene Ganga flowing beneath and soak in the beautiful environment from a spot in the Ashram or from the ghat nearby.

title: A suspended bridge
review: It’s a suspended bridge joining the two parts of the hill across river ganga in Rishikesh. It joins swargashram with tapovan. I recommend one to wear comfortable shoes and cross it on foot.

title: It's not the destination, but the journey.
review: The location is great. But what I enjoyed most was the journey of walking by the bridge and the crowd. Being able to immerse yourself with the surrounding is really all about the culture and the people. Feel the colours and the friendliness of the people in India through the booths you'd pass by and the streets where they'd chat you up and share their insights with you (if you're willing to stop by). For those cultural spirits!

title: Beautiful
review: What an experience The is a place where you will see India coming together. Culture and people from around India along with a lot of foreigners. This is a must visit place when going to Rishikesh. Try to avoid taking your vehicles and visit cafes in this area for the great food they serve very Holy place it’s true after been feel change of life

title: Holy peace
review: Surrounded by mountain. And water is cold and clean. You can cross the river by jhula I liked the laxman jhula area more then ram jhula .

title: Nice
review: Quite similar to the laxman jhula but on a smaller scale with less people and less confusion however still worth a visit

title: Ram jhoola
review: It is a suspended bridge across the river Ganges . Other side is parmarth Niketan ashram where in the evening their is lovely Aarti performed by young students with musical instruments.on the car parking side there are lovely shops of handicrafts and beautiful kurta and Kurtis and best of dresses for Ladies. Worth going.

title: Normal bridge connecting two ends of the river Ganges in Rishikesh
review: Just a normal bridge connecting two ends of the river Ganges in Rishikesh & the chaos created by the honking & speeding two wheeler on the bridge is totally irritable experience,they two wheeler drivers just dont care about people walking on bridge which is meant for people & keep speeding,u need to be careful about the speeding ones & give side to these guys,not worth at all walking this one

title: Check out both sides
review: Both the Sivananda and Swarg sides of the bridge are filled with interesting shops and restaurants. It is definitely worth a visit.  Walks a bridge one-way dodging scooters and take the Riverferry the other way for a nice round-trip

title: Great way to cross ganga
review: Ram Jhula and laxman jhula are atleast 3 km apart and it is better to get off at ram jhula and enjoy rishikesh. Laxman jhula is for visual appeal of the rishikesh.

title: Breathtaking view of Ganga ma
review: View of ganga ma from this jhula/bridge is simply can't be explained in words , although ferry is available if you want to travel .

title: Ram Jhula the famous suspension bridge!
review: Ram Jhula,is one of the main attractions of world's yoga capital - Rishikesh! It is a suspension bridge, which was built over the River Ganges in the year 1986. It has great view of the Ganges river! The bridge is full of live daily! Take your time to stroll around here take lots of pics! And enjoy all the savoury available around the vicinity!

title: Nice to cross, but busy and more functional
review: Nice to cross for the view, but the bridge is very busy (with a scooters) so not a relaxt place and more functional. The bridge is a main road to cross the river. Many shops, restaurants, temples and ceremonies are located at the other side of the river and the 'normal' road is very much longer (no option). Although nice to cross for t mee view and visit the Ganga both sides.

title: Oldest Cable Bridge but too narrow to accomdate Two Wheeler and Pedastrians
review: One of the Oldest Cable Bridge. View near Ram Jhula is scenic. Ghats near Ram Jhula are nice for baths in Ganga. Bridge is too narrow and though both two wheeler and Pedastrians pass on it. Difficult for tourists to stand for few minutes as too crowdy. Bridge is connecting one part of Rishikesh with Geeta Bhavan, Swagashram etc. There are several shops of local products sold on the way to bridge. Geeta Bhavan has also counter for selling cloths and other products.

title: Amazing structure bogged down by two wheelers
review: First of all...out of the 2 cable bridges in Rishikesh, this is definitely the one to visit as it is much less crowded than the Laxman Jhula. It also provides excellent views of the river ghats.

title: The famous Bridge and the ghat view
review: Ram Jhula is the new bridge (compared to Lakshman) which gives an amazing view of the Ganga ghats of Rishikesh connecting Muni Ki Reti. It's quite crowded at regular hours with two wheelers coming from both directions. Come early morning or late nights.

title: Awesome location
review: Ram Jhula is the new of the two bridges in Rishikesh. Normally used by tourist to come to parmarth Niketan for Aarti or for eating in the famous food joints like chotiwala. Also you can enjoy sitting on the banks of the river close to the bridge.

title: Evening visit
review: We visited Ram Jhoola in the evening , on our way to Parmarth aarti. The Jhoola was crowded, not helped by scooters and bikes, and their incessant honking. The Jhoola was not meant for that kind of crossing, and the authorities should do something about it.

title: Ram Jhula, Rishikesh
review: It is a 70 yr old suspension bridge across the Ganges connecting the southern to northern side,where many famous Ashrams like Sivananda are located.Nice place for Selfies n beautiful view!

title: Mixed experience
review: The walk on jhoola was not so exciting because of two wheelers and traffic. However, found sitting on the ghats near the ram jhoola was nice. Enjoyed taking bath too.

title: Nice Place
review: It is also same as laxman jhula. Bridge is maintained superbly even local people riding  bikes and cycle over this bridge.

title: Worth visit in evening time
review: We had visited in late evening and its worth watching river gaga from top. And atmosphere which we had watched from besides of jula is memorable. And lighting from other side and clouds sets on river was so beautiful that i m not able to narrate it. In short it was too beautiful and memorable visit.

title: Very crowdy
review: Very crowded. Lots of two wheeler vehicle and cows. Difficult to walk. And also people clicking photos and selfie make more difficult to cross.

title: Awesome
review: It connects Muni Ki Reti to Swargashram area. Nice scenic view from here. After crossing it, there are lots of food options available, famous Chotiwala restaurant is also there. Some clean Ganga Ghats are also there specially Geeta Bhavan ghat.

title: A place not to miss
review: I liked Ram Jhula more than Laxman jhula because of the ghats and the views, and less crowd. Serene.

title: Serene place
review: Place has a certain serenity with river flowing underneath a mildly shaking suspension bridge. Enjoy the breeze

title: Ram Jhula (Rishikesh)
review: Rishikesh has got a charm in itself. Temples, water sports, hiking, Beatles Ashram, Yoga, Meditation etc... Standing on this Ram Jhula gets you an amazing view of the River Ganga. This place is located in the state of Uttrakhand and at a drive of 5 hrs from Delhi

title: must visit place in Rishikesh
review: its a one of the main attraction place for tourists in Rishikesh , its a midly shaking suspension bridge.

title: "Once u are in the middle, just close your eyes and take a deep breath and fill the pure riverside oxygen in ur lunghs"
review: Slightly undulated ancient bridge which helps people, cattle and two wheelers to cross. Saves lot of miles of travel and connects North Hrishikesh to south. South of the Hrishikesh is known as tapobhoomi, as many sadhakas were doing Japa, Tapa and various sadhanas right from the ancient time as this place was untouched by outsiders.

title: Bridges, the Unique elements of Rishikesh
review: Ram jhula is the bridge connecting the opposite banks of the Ganga in Rishikesh. Our driver dropped us near the steps. The steps were quite steep and we saw the elderly struggle down the same to reach the bridge. One can cross the bridge , take some pics. On the other side there were a couple of temples and ashrams.

title: Different feelings at different hours of a day.
review: Built in the year 1986, one of the iconic landmarks of City, Ram Jhula is 750 ft. long iron suspension bridge over river Ganga with no pillars; connecting Ashrams located in Muni Ki Reti to Gita Bhawan, Parmarth Niketan and other temples located in Swargashram. Ram Jhula is similar in design, but bigger than Lakshman Jhula.

title: Lively place for Yoga, Ganga visit, and shopping
review: Visited Ram Jhula almost daily during my stay at Rishikesh to drink freshly squeezed sugarcane juice, and visit Ganga.

title: A famous Landmark
review: Ram jhula is a iron suspension bridge over river Ganga, it is situated approx 3 km north-east from the town Rishikesh.

title: I love Rishikesh
review: I visit Rishikesh last month and Ramjhula best place in Rishikesh. Near market is very good and the bridge very long and old. Love ashram near bridge and shops.

title: Engineering Dime at Holy Site
review: We went to Ram Jhula as first attraction when we arrived at Rishikesh. A good engineering example at holy site. some were even using two-wheeler to cross over the bridge. To be true to words, Ram jhula offers a good view of river Ganga, a slow wind over the bridge and a location for photography. This cultural landmark is auspicious and energetic point. must visit.

title: Nice
review: The jhula is too nice and cool.But due to huge traffic on small pathway of Ram Ghula it is hard to explore.

title: Crowded spot
review: Rishikesh was crowded, hot and humid during my travel to this place. But had a great Darshan here. Please do not miss it

title: Very famous Jhula
review: This is one of the famous attraction in Rishikesh. This Jhula is on holy river Ganga. View from Jhula is very beautiful.

title: Great views
review: The views from this bridge were great. But that's about it. It was overcrowded pushing against each other. In addition to that, motorbikes and scooters are allowed to move on this narrow footbridge which adds to the pain.

title: Glorious Ganga by suspension bridge
review: When visiting Rishikesh (near Geeta Bhawan) the bridge upstream from the main village is here.  It is called Ram Jhula.  It is an absolute must see.  The view from here is increab!  You can see Ganga Maa sa la la upstream, downstream you can see a curve in the banks of the river.  The bridge is constantly visited by monkey families and cows.  The cows and even bulls are generally gentle and blend in with the crowd.  The monkeys, not so much.  Take caution not to have food in your hands and to have your valuables well stowed or you may just be held up by a monkey!  This is where the Ganges leaves the Himalaya and starts her journey into the plains of India.  A magical spot.  If you time it right (evening hours)  you can even be serenaded by the monks from the Hare Krsna Temple, singing beautiful bhajans!

title: The swinging bridge !!
review: Crossing this bridge you can see the Ganges flowing though at some places its covered with plastic net.

title: If you have extra time
review: The bridge is very crowded.. and also taking pictures on the bridge is not allowed. Bridge does swing/vibrate while you are on it. You can get shared auto from the market. You wont miss anything if you are not able to visit it. But i think if you are nearby,you should at least visit one bridge either ram jhula or lakhshaman jula.

title: Bridge connecting banks of holy Ganges
review: Ram Jhula connects both the banks of the Ganges, similar to the Lakshman Jhula situated 2 km away. The bridge per se is very narrow and only humans, bikes and cows are allowed. The bridge vibrates most of the time and you can feel the bridge moving. Make sure to accompany elder person in this bridge as they may need help when cows or bikes roam the bridge.

title: Smaller than Laxman Jhula
review: A suspension bridge to cross the mighty Ganges. The whole area is a beauty to experience. Do spare your evenings for a stroll and a bit of shopping may be...

title: Second Best To Only One
review: Built as a second option (or a belated twin) to Lakshman Jhula, it is amongst one of the most popular attractions for most tourists in Rishikesh.Tsctically built almost 3-4 kms before Lakshman Jhula, this younger suspension bridge is also a lifeline for almost every visitor who wishes to cross over between Tehri and Pauri sides of the Ganga. Its also placed closer to the Rishikesh main road, with many small ghats, shops  and street vendors lining up the approach road. A great place for street shoppers - provided you are a shrewd bargainer.

title: A very important reference point in Rishikesh
review: Be careful with the bikes! Ram Jhula is an important reference and access point to the Swarg Ashram area of Rishikesh. Also because of this, the bridge is always full of people and bikes crossing it both sides. It's common to see monkeys on the Swargashram side of it, so be careful with your bananas! :) Enjoy Rishikesh!

title: Good memories
review: When inreached Raam jhula,  i shocked first time I seen like jhula through river it's great memory to me.i can't forget this in my life.

title: Foot bridge across the River Ganga
review: An experience of India not to be missed. Ganges flowing swiftly below, the ashrams and ghats in full view, the shops selling local merchandise, music & typical indian kitch real time.

title: ram jhula
review: being sawan month full of crowd. heavy traffic. traffic poorlymanaged due to unexceptional croud of sawan 1st monday

title: Good place.
review: This is near laksham jhula. Good place to see if you are in the twin city of haridwar and rishikesh. Avoid going on 1st monday of Shrawan. There will be too much crowd.

title: Okayish
review: The Jhula is okay, but the surroundings are very dirty. The local authorities should do some effort to clean the place up.

title: One time experience
review: Just go there to calm down your excitement. this is nothing like a attraction point, instead this is a bridge who connects two point, Which people use. People drives in it which must stop immediately and this make life difficult for walkers.

title: Sweet little adventure!
review: Love to be on Ram jhula, my daughter was so excited that she crossed it 4 times without stopping just to have that experience! :) it shakes when u walk on it n thats why its really a Jhula and not just a bridge. In evening u wud love it more when u get to see everything lightened around u. The only negative is that bikes are allowed on the jhula so it really becomes crowded and creates a nuisance for those who walk. It connects the two market streets across river.

title: New attraction in Rishikesh
review: Rishikesh was famous for rope bridge Laxman Tula. Now another bridge Ram zula. This is similar to Laxman Zula and the bridge swings as pilgrims walk on it. One should visit in the evening so you can see the beautiful lighting for the bridge as you approach it.

title: Second monument built across the river Ganges
review: It is similar to Lakshman Jhula & this overlooks the route to Char Dham. It is very crowded & hardly one gets a chance to click long shot of the bridge with only their dear ones.

title: Okey
review: Holiday mood everywhere so crowd is expected everywhere. Bridge over river ganges to go to other side is nice. It swings when you walk

title: A disaster waiting to happen
review: Crossing the Ram Jhula was pretty traumatic. There are milling crowds, two - wheelers, and cows crossing at the same time. One cow also did a U turn and decided to go back.

title: ram jhula
review: Ram Jhula is a useful pedestrian bridge across the Ganga to connect both the sides. Since this has been made recently, I wish it had been made wider. It is extremely crowded. Motorcycles and bicycles should not be allowed on this Jhula. The approach through  steps from the road is risky with broken steps and missing railings at various points.

title: Bridge across the River Ganga
review: Locals and tourists use it to get across the river , Two wheelers are also allowed , nice view of the river , has a nice temple with a beautiful Shiva statue just down the road ,

title: Great Shopping
review: THE BEST place to shop for malas, jewelry and statues is Neelkanth Gems. Owner Sanjeev will always greet you with a big smile and tell you "sit, sit." In addition to the amazing amount of stock showing, he has much tucked away: real gems, more malas than anywhere in town, tons of statues, lots of jewelry (stone,silver). A certified gemologist and real rock hound, he has a rock shop upstairs as well, and has forgotten more about rocks and stones than most other shopkeepers know.  Have been shopping there since 2012!!

title: it is gr8 view
review: this is a life time experience for me and i am very much interested to go this place again and again river rafting was awesome and living in Tents are a new experience for me

title: inconvenient for pedestrians
review: it is inconvenient for pedestrians, especially the old,  to walk on this bridge since two wheelers are also allowed on it.

title: Amazing Bridge built on wires
review: It was great experience to visit this old wire bridge at Ganga River.  Though the bridge was narrow, people, cattles and even bikers were using it.

title: The twin of Laksman Jhula
review: Same bridge crossing Gangga just as Laksman Jhula which is located about 1km from Laksman Jhula. Narrow, but not as congested as Laksman Jhula I think. And nearby of the bridge there are some beaches which is nice for a relax time, also shops selling souvenirs.

title: A bridge not too far
review: Ram and Laxman jhoolas are suspended bridges which sway with wind and loading. Ram jhoola is narrow and with 2 wheelers allowed it is crowded and risky. But you must walk over it !

title: Religious outing
review: It was a nice Sunday spent enjoying the local Bazaar . Parking is a big issue but expensive paid parking available.

title: Bridge to Swarg (Heaven) Ashram
review: Ram Jhula is a suspension bridge used by pedestrians to go to Swarg AShram from Rishikesh side and same way ascetics from that side come to take conveyance to the Char Dham yatra. It gives a superb view from the bridge. It is narrow but a modern bridge and very essential. Cool breeze experienced on this while crossing and the scenic beauty is worth expereincing.

title: Most happening place in Rishikesh.
review: The bank under Ram Jhula is safe for bathing. The market starting from Ram Jhula has a great market where traditional clothes, and gift itesm can be purchased at decent budgets or cheap. Snacks also available easy. This is Rishikesh chowpatty overall.

title: bigger and busier then laxman jhula
review: traffic chaos rules supreme in high seasons where two wheelers and pedestrians compete in crossing it first..however this gets a check when cops forbid 2 wheelers from 6 pm till 9pm or turn it into one way

title: Not a bridge but a SWING
review: As you walk across the bridge it shakes and so the name is given jhula n not bridge... Loved walking through it as no photography was allowed on the bridge as it is the peak season there was too much rush on the Ram jhula so for maintaining traffic such notices were written

title: Great View
review: Walking on this bridge gives you stunning view of the ghats, especially of the Ganges flowing below as well as of Paramarth Niketan. But two wheelers coming on the bridge really irritates.

title: Must see
review: As famous as d Lakshman Jhula is the Ram Jhula. Since this suspension bridge is little away from Tapovan(most popular area in Rishikesh), it's not that crowded. U can easily take ur two wheelers on this bridge. It's an amazing experience to pass through this suspension bridge connecting two opposite sides of Rishikesh, overlooking d Ganga River. An unbelievable experience

title: Nice Place
review: When you are in Rishikesh, it is bound to visit Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula. It is very crowded but a wonderful experience.

title: Good one
review: F Ram Jhula is just like lakshman Jhula we were told n hence we just saw the ram Jhula. Request u to take a guide here who will charge just 100rs. Only then u understand d importance of the temples here else they will just be mere temples. Heard some great stories about d pandavas after kurukshetra war.

title: Too crowded
review: It's a suspension bridge across the river Ganga. Gets too crowded all the time with cycles and two wheelers.

title: Mesmerizing view
review: The walk on the ram jhula is very enchanting with the Ganges flowing below and the clear sky above. We would stop after some steps and see the boats and rafting activity in the ganges.

title: same as laxman pull
review: hanging pull and yes it has the same situation like the laxman jhula where there is a lot of jam created due to bikes

title: A decent walk but avoidable during peak tourist season
review: One would rather take the boat across the river instead of walking on the Ram Jhula. It's a nice walk no doubt but during peak tourist season it's better avoided as you get a feeling on walking on a local railway overbridge

title: Swing while walking
review: Ram Jhula is awesome, we would have gone on it 3-4 times to go across to the other side of river Ganga. It is beautifully lit up in the evening and looks amazing. Watching the flow of ganga from the bridge is lovely. Only drawback is the two wheelers and those pestering scooters and motor bikes on the bridge while you are walking, they constantly honk and are all around you while you are walking. Had it been restricted only to pedestrians it would have been great.

title: Just like Lakshman Jhula
review: Ram Jhula is just like the Lakshman Jhula. It's a nice walk but again quite crowded with motorcycles & cows on the bridge.

title: Awesome Ram Jhula
review: Visited Rishikesh first time, heard lots about Laxman Jhula since my childhood, but when seen Ram Jhula specially at night (24th April) then we forgot everything, it was mind blowing experience, spent lots of time by sitting at Gangas bank alongwith spouse.

title: Literally Jhula
review: It shakes as you move over the bridge. my daughter got scared and wanted to run back to the starting of the bride. The problem I feel is the two wheeler which also cross the river using this bridge. Its in a way reducing the life of the bridge.

title: Good
review: In day time, walk around visiting temples on either side, do some trinket shopping, have south Indian food in Madras cafe, enjoy brownies on the cafes, have lunch at Chotiwala, settle down in ashrams in the evening. Enjoy ganga aarti of Parmarth Niketan on one side or the Shatrughan Ghat on the other side. Watch rafters return to rishikesh base in the evening. a Nice experience.

title: Not the same as Laxman Jhula
review: For me, Ram Jhula is not at all the same as Laxman Jhula. It feels like many other Indian religio-tourist towns. That's not to say you should avoid it. There are shops, restaurants and ghats, and of course Ashrams.

title: Enchanting Jhula
review: View of the Ram Jhula from Shatrugan Ghat was mesmerizing at night, as lights were litted up. The reflection of the same in the river Ganga was breathtaking.

title: The other side of Rishikesh
review: This is my fav spot of my month in Rishikesh, ashrams, Ganga river, mountains, monkies and the beautiful market.

title: Nice to walk in the evenings
review: You can see the river ganga flowing below the bridge. good to walk early morning & evening. Beware of cycles & scooters on the bridge.

title: Visited at night. Nice view.
review: Great to take a stroll. Nice views. Parking charges are huge i.e. 150 as compared to Rs. 50 at laxman jhula. However, this is more approachable as compared to laxman jhula.

title: The main Place of Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is main place of Rishikesh, located at Price location with many Ganga Ghats, Temples and Market. In night the view becomes amazing. This is a must visit with nearby locations.

title: Beautiful Iron Suspension Bridge
review: Ram Jhula in Rishikesh is one of the most famous attractions here for tourists. Built in 1986 it is a Suspension Bridge and connects the two famous ashrams, the Sivanand Ashram and Swarg Ashram over the river Ganges. It is less popular and lesser crowded than its sibling The Laxman Jhula. It is also little wider and is spanned across around 200+ meters on Ganges.

title: First hanging bridge before Laxman Jhula....
review: We actually pitched tent near Ram jhula and stayed for a night. First time staying in tent with my wife and kid and near ganga river, ram jhula, experience was unforgettable. At night they turn lights on for sometime on jhula, which looks beautiful.

title: connecting bridge
review: Its a narrow bridge connecting from the city approach to the main market across ganga and lands very near the Ganga Aarti ghat

title: Wonderful Hanging Bridge
review: The bring over the river Ganga is so wonderful. The bridge is always shaking due to lots of people passing over it

title: Bridge on Ganga
review: This bridge connects main road to other side of the ganga ghat. There is rush on bridge especially at evening time, have some patience!! One should visit parmarth niketan, geeta bhavan across the river.

title: a busy place!
review: This is the wider of the two bridges but equally as congested. It is busy throughout the day with people stopping to take photos, bikes and scooters trying to push their way through. Monkeys on the lookout for food and cows, large and small crossing or resting ready to finish crossing. It all makes for an interesting but safe crossing.

title: ram jhula.
review: ram jhula is just a bridge and on the end of the bridge are small shops .I wouldn't recommend it but if on the way then do visit.

title: Do visit here if you come to Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is also a major attraction of tourists in Rishikesh. This is an iron suspension bridge that connects Shivananda Ashram and Swargashram. This bridge give panoramic view of the holy river Ganges and the temples situated nearby.

title: Ram Jhoola - a connection
review: While people talk a lot about this bridge and Lakshman Jhoola but they do not seem to have a mythological connection with the fact that these bridges are manmade. its a hanging bridge over the river Ganga and connects the lands of both sides. There are two modes of transportation - By Boat or via Ram and Lakshman Jhoola.

title: Good view of Ganga from the Ram Jhula
review: Ram Jhula connecting both ends of the Ganga is example of technology and from this place a good view of ganga is seen amongst the heavy wind webs

title: Iconic structure
review: Ram Jhula is an iconic road cantilever bridge which connects the two banks of river Ganga in the holy city of Rishikesh. One can enjoy a panaromic view of the upper climbs of the mountains on one side with river Ganga flowing in its own pristine beauty and downstream Ganga waters on the other . The only irritation is constantly passing two wheelers blaring horns and disturbing the walking people . I hope they construct another bridge which can be used solely by two wheelers

title: Icon
review: This is one of the icon place in Rishikesh. Its super crowded and not comfortable to pass on it. It connects between 1 market to the other. At night light will be up and its good to take pictures with those background.

title: Lighted bridge!
review: It was amazing to see lights on a bridge hanging over a wide, roaring river. Both ram and Laxman jula are must-visit places in Rishikesh

title: Ram Jhula
review: This is around 4-5 kms from Triveni Ghat. If you visit Ram Jhula at night then its lit with beautiful lights and the view is amazing. You got famous chotiwala restaurant also nearby. So walk upto Ram Jhula and then feast on some good food at Chotiwala restaurant.

title: A beautiful place
review: It's actually a beautiful and scenery place ti visit The water was so beautiful. It just can be quite annoying when all those motorcycles cross the bridge but overall it's good

title: Awesome views .....
review: The Ram Jhula is larger and wider than the bridge I crossed earlier (Lakshman Jhula) today, but provides a passage for locals, tourists, carts, and motorbikes. Both bridges have movement, but nothing scary.  You can find small shops on both sides, so bring your spending money.  I carry small currency denominations for tips, offerings, and local transportation.  For something different, we crossed the river by a local ferry for people.  Offered another view of the bridge from below.  Hope this helps for your first visit.  I love the Indian people.

title: Your gateway to Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula has the larger Taxi rank of the two Bridges, and taxis prefer to take you here. Ram Jhula is “a little” quieter than Laxman. Less shopping options but some interesting places to see. Take a boat across the Ganga to the Ashram/temple shopping side of the river. Iyengar Yoga Studio near the Taxi parking. Hotels.

title: Ram Jhula is a famous landmark place in Rishikesh city.
review: Ram Jhula has the length of 450 feet connecting Shivananda Ashram with Swargashram.Ram Jhula is placed a few miles downstream from Laxman Jhula

title: take a boat trip
review: Instead of crossing the Ram Jhula, you might decide to cross Laxman Jhula on foot. Rather take a boat ride acorss the river (Rs 10 per person on shared boat) to have the best view of Rm Jhula

title: nice location and good experience of ram juhla, when we walk on jhula ,its shake slightly.
review: nice to see ram jhula. its a unique bridge on ganga river. can see the flow of the river from jhula. nice architecher of jhula

title: A trip not complete without crossing this bridge
review: Beautiful views of Ganga, the mountains, Sivananda Ashram and Swarg Ashram,  Be careful of the motorcycles, Watch people feeding the fish

title: Amazing
review: Amazing ..everyone should visit once..i will come back with my friends and i will take them to ram jhula ..

title: A mix between Rishikesh town and Laxman Jhula
review: It is less touristic than Laxman Jhula but it still has a good infrastructure for tourism and also has some real indian life like Rishikesh town.

title: A view from the river
review: Much larger (and perhaps not as pretty) as Lakshman Jhula, I saw this iconic Rishikesh bridge from the river as I crossed Ma Ganga by ferry.

title: A beautiful suspended bridge across River Ganga
review: This bridge is much larger and broader when compared to lakshman Jhula. We have to cross over the bridge to go to Parmarth Niketan where the Aarthi for Ganga takes place in the evening. The bridge is nice and vibrates on movement of two wheelers over it.  But  it is manageable as it is broader when compared to the other one. it is a pleasant walk on the bridge which has many shops on both end roads

title: One of the best places to visit and even better if you can capture sunset from there.
review: When staying in rishikesh, you will have to definitely visit this, One of the historic as well as one of the beautiful bridges

title: Close to the aarthi ceremony
review: This is the closest bridge to the aarthi ceremony at Parmath Niketan Ashram. Inevitably, there's a market close by and some reasonably good local restaurants too.

title: Ram Jhula Centre of Rishikesh
review: We couldn't miss Ram Jhula staying in Rishikesh and its a major hub for spiritualism, pilgrimages, yoga festival, aarti ghat and food and learning. As a traveler it is a place for rejuvenation of the self, the place is vegetarian, religious and there is lots of harmonizing activities around this area like Ayurveda, books around all these areas, Vedic astrology and food.

title: Similar to Laxman Jhula
review: It is same as Laxman Jhula. Every day thousands of people cross the Bridge. You can also cross it on your 2 wheelers.

title: Only two bridge
review: I visited this place with my family.there is nothing to see.only there are two bridge on the Ganga river.many foreign ng tourist visit this place.but the scenery make you feel quite good.but nothing to see.at this place the mini bazar established.if you want to buy something for your relative you get that thing in mini bazar.if you free time in Rishikesh then go there.thank you

title: Beautiful bridge
review: Iconic bridge on river Ganga. One gets a beautiful view of the mighty Ganga and Rishikesh city from the bridge. There is a nice ghat on the Ganga and other old temples and places of interest are also located near the Ram Jhula.

title: Long bridge over the Ganga
review: Ram Jhula  connects the city to the area which has multiple temples. It is much longer than Lakshman Jhula. Only pedestrians and bikes are allowed on this bridge and it gets very dark after sunset as there are no street lights.

title: Beautiful place to visit
review: Good place to visit and walk on,  great view but vehicles are allowed on the jhula which creates nuisance.

title: Lovely Bridge
review: Ram Jhula provides a good link between the banks of the River Ganges. One enjoys crossing the iron-suspension bridge. There are hundreds of local people as well as tourists crossing the bridge.

title: Good place for shopping!
review: The bridge itself doesn't have anything special, but on both sides you can go for a walk and find lots of small, cheap shops for your souvenirs and clothes

title: Ram jhula
review: Ram jhula a wonderful bridge over the river Ganges. Walk over the bridge is very nice looking to the bottom of river Ganges

title: Great place but highly crowded
review: The place is a great example of architecture but highly crowded. The worst thing is that even two wheelers are allowed on this place. The paid parking near ram jhula is of rs. 150. Too high.

title: A Lovely Quiet Bridge
review: This bridge is across from Laxman Jhula.  It is quiet and leads to a quiet path in the countryside. The energy is soft, a lovely experience.

title: Crowded
review: I was staying near Ram Jhula, so had to cross it a few times. crowded with 2 wheelers, people and some monkeys.

title: Still some local features and affordable prices
review: The market area around Ram Julla is vibrant and prices are more reasonable than Laxman Julla. You can cross to the other side by paying 10 rupees for the boat and you can avoid the traffic jam on the bridge :)

title: Get a good view crossing the Ganges
review: Take a stroll over the bridge and admire the Ganges below. Just be careful as some time there are motorcyclist who use the bridge too.

title: Walk on the swinging bridge
review: I will say better than Laxman Jhula as it is more wider and less crowded. Walk on this bridge from west to east to reach Swargashram

title: Beautiful!
review: I visited last year and this is a suspension bridge with people walking and two wheelers plying on it. I loved the view from this bridge. It's built on a river. One feels very calm here.

title: Beautiful
review: Ram is beautiful, walking on a suspension bridge is always fun, there is enough space for everyone there, pedestrians, bike, cows every one was there, view of Maa Ganga is beautiful

title: Great View
review: Ram Jula is just like Lakshman Jhula. One should must visit one of these. Children love this place. :)

title: Average
review: Not an attraction id recommend as there's nothing special there..  It's crowded.. Good for a one-time visit..

title: Scenic place
review: Good view. Number of shops are there nearby for shopping. Various restaurants are there which offer varieties of food.

title: best attraction of rishikesh
review: This bridge is the next one after lakshman jhoola. This bridge provides connectivity to the main market full of cafes and ashrams, Again one needs to be cautious of the monkeys

title: RAM JHULA
review: Ram Jhula is situated adjecent to lakshman Jhula.  This is also like lakshman Jhula.  When somebody walk on it feels like we are taking the swings.its moving in the air

title: Nice Location with Hanging Bridge
review: Great location, you can directly reach ganga water from the ghat. Picteresque location. You will get shared jeep, 10 rs/person, from lakshman jhula to this location. Lot of photography is recommended

title: The best place to be in Rishikesh
review: Its just not about the Ramjhula alone but its about the 2.5 km stretch spread across the banks of the holy river Ganga.

title: Good for Walk. Aarti & Market Area nearby
review: We reached Ram Jhula from Lakshman Jhula area by Vikram (6-seater autorickshaw). We were charged Rs 20 per person. However the correct fare is Rs 5 or Rs 10 max. It dropped us on the main road itself & we had to walk to reach the bridge. There is market near the bridge. However we found the market to be expensive - compared to Lakshman Jhula or Triveni Ghar market. You will find many shops offering Rafting & other Adventure activities. Our rafting was included in our Adventure Camp stay itself, so we didn't check out Rafting/Adventure Camp options here. This bridge is a bit bigger than Lakshman Jhula & walk on it is a good experience. However 2-wheelers are allowed on this bridge as well & hence you will hear horn sound regularly. Shatrughan Ghat is near it - where Ganga Aarti happens in the evening. You get a good view of Ganges & this bridge from Shatrughan Ghat. If the bridge was illuminated at night, then the view would have been more beautiful at night. Parmarth Niketan Ashram is another famous place near this bridge - where Ganga Aarti happens & is very famous for Aarti as well as Yoga. Another famous Ashram nearby it is Swarg Ashram. Restaurants (Chotiwala at the Ganges) & snacks joints are also nearby. Good to visit once

title: Good narrow bridge
review: It's a good attraction to visit once but vehicles create lot of pollution. Not well maintained and illuminated.

title: Gem of rishikesh
review: It's a historic slightly swinging jhula connecting one end of the holy river Ganga to another. Provides great view of river Ganga and scenic beauty around.

title: Ram Jhula a must visit
review: I love this place, it's lively, busy, and at times hectic, but I wouldnt have it any other way.  It's a must see for anyone visiting Rishikesh for the first time.  At first it can be quite overwhelming, especailly if its busy, but once you get through the crowd, the river is astouding, and the sunsets heavenly.

title: Walk across the bridge and sit beside the Ganga
review: We walked across the Ram Jhula on a sunny winter morning. We came across people from different lands, mendicants, shops selling all kinds of things, ashrams, and a mobile bakery that sells warm cookies. All beside the Ganges. A 2 km walk takes you to the ruins of the Maharishi Ashram, made famous by The Beatles. It was a great, relaxing experience.

title: Spiritual visit
review: A bridge above Ganga Ji which is allowed for 2 wheelers so it is very crowded and hard to click pics. There are a nearby market and boat ride facility which takes 15rs per person both sides ( can go to fill water of Ganga Ji from the middle).

title: A very eventful bridge
review: Imagine this - second day in India, first time crossing the narrow bridge to find accommodation on foot thinking this is simply a foot bridge across the Ganga.. you then find yourself wedged between an oncoming two-wheeler, people and a cow. Carrying all your worldly possessions, the cow takes a shine to you and drops its head (with horns) and picks up pace coming towards you - what do you do?

title: Ram Jhula!!!
review: The Ram Hula bridge was too good. The river view was superb and fantastic. We went to this place early morning.

title: Nice
review: Decent views of the Ganges.

title: Good architecture
review: Another excellent engineering architecture in rishikesh. Very near to parmarth Niketan and Geeta Bhawan. Shops are available nearby.

title: Ram Jhula Bridge
review: Good to see the 2nd famous bridge in Rishikesh. We passed through it on motorbike. Cows like to pass on it also!

title: nice views
review: ram jhula and laxman jhula are top attraction of rishikesh. views from middle of bridge was awesome. visit early morning because it is very crowed

title: across the bridge on a bike
review: Great feeling when you get the view of the shops along side the River Ganga.

title: nice place
review: the place is nice, i found many people who stay calm to listen, near to town only five minutes walking.

title: Bridge across Ganga
review: This bridge is called Ram Jula while the other is called Laxman Jula. We walked across the Ganga on this bridge and while returning used the boat ... just Rs.10 per head

title: Oscilating bridge
review: This is also a very old bridge established to cross the river, Ganga. If you stand in the middle of the bridge that you can feel that the bridge is actually oscillating. this is an amazing feeling.

title: Not much to be excited about
review: Sure the bridge is old and for its time, it could have been a great thing. But, in today's world, I don't thing it should be a tourist attraction. It's just a hanging very small bridge giving a decent view of Rishikesh. That's all about it.

title: Bigger suspension bridge
review: This bridge is bigger than the Lakshman Jhula and so it is called the Ram Jhula. Like Lakshman Jhula, it aids in connecting the two sides of River Ganga. River Ganga can be seen flowing calmly below. Walk on the bridge was peaceful except for the haunting of two wheelers. Great engineering work to build the bridge.

title: Swings from the history part 1
review: Built over the Ganga river connecting two cities. It is another beautiful bridge but not as good as the Lakshman jhoola. One time experience is must for all the travellers. The feel that you get while crossing the bridge over the flowing Ganga is unparallel.

title: Good place to walk around
review: the ram jhula is very good place to walk around. There are lot of shopping options. The best restaurants of rishikesh are around this jhula. you can buy some fish food and food them from   jhula.

title: It's wonderful spending 45 minutes in the eve on it though crowded
review: Ram Jhula is an iron suspension bridge across the Ganga G which is connecting two Divine side of Rishikesh..

title: must visit place in Rishikesh
review: Ram jhula connects the two parts of the Rishikesh Tehri Garhwal with Pauri Garhwal.

title: Pleasant walk between Twin bridges
review: Well worth a visit but is identical to lukshman bridge down the river. Is a very pleasant walk between the two through the woods.

title: Best view of the Mighty Ganges
review: This is a pedestrian suspended cable bridge offering a great view the Mighty Ganges and the river banks across both sides. These are photographers paradise. It really doesn't get any better than this. Beware of Cows and Monkeys, they happen to be more frequent end users than tourist like us.

title: Watch out for the motor bikes!
review: This is one of the bridges In Rishikesh that spans the Ganges and allows people to get from one side to the other. Teeming with people it is a bird’s eye view of India with everyone going about their business, watch out for the motorbikes though!

title: Lovely  view of the Ganga from this bridge
review: Although this is a pedestrian bridge, many 2 wheelers zoom across it spoiling the peace and quiet.  You can see up and down the river and both sides of the city from here.

title: It's different
review: Nice views from the Jhula (Bridge) and from across the Jhula.

title: Ram jhula
review: View from the centre of the bridge is awesome. Enjoy the scenic beauty of rishikesh here. Very narrow bridge. However you can rent a bike in rishikesh and explore everything it has to offer.

title: Good view of the Ganges from Ram Jhula
review: It can be reachable by taking share auto. Other places like Swargashram, Gita Bhavan are all nearby to Ram Jhula. It offered magnificent view of the Ganges. We went there in both evening and in the morning. In the morning we crossed the bridge and went to Swargashram and Gita Bhavan. In the evening we were sitting in the stair case dipping our feet in the holy Ganges, enjoying the chill breeze around and viewing Ganga Aarthi at Swargashram from the other side. It was not at all crowded at the place were we were viewing the Aarthi. The next day morning, when we crossed the bridge, there were lot of crowd. 2 wheeler were causing congestion. There are good vegetarian restaurants available at both side. On one side there is Madras Cafe and on the other side of the bridge there is Chotiwala restaurant. Lakshman Jhula was about 30 min to walk from Ram Jhula. We walked till Lakshman Jhula enjoying viewing the holy Ganges.

title: Peaceful
review: Had a beautiful experience. The place has a lot of positivity and makes you feel immediately connected to something deeper inside you .

title: Don't forget to enjoy boating here
review: Do not forget to opt for boating to cross river Ganga which is easily available from both the banks. Ram jhula n Laxman Jhula are two similar typ of bridges so it would be better to cross river by boating in Ganga instead of using the bridge to cross the river. You will enjoy it. But parking nearby is too costly. I have paid INR 150 for less than 1 hour of parking.

title: If you are visiting  Rishikesh , Ram Jhula must be your first stop
review: Positioned in Muni Ki Reti, Ram Jhula is one of the most popular attractions of Rishikesh. This suspension kind of  bridge was constructed later than  Laxman Jhula, in the year 1980. Both these bridges are quite similar in design and steel construction.  Ram Jhula is placed a few miles downstream from Laxman Jhula and links Swarg Ashram on the western bank of River Ganga to the Sivananda Ashram on the eastern bank . From  the Jhula we could several groups of tourists engaged in white water rafting on the Ganges including a few girls swimming along one of such groups. The evening Arti also takes place at a Ghat close to Ram Jhula passing through the market .

title: Fantastic View of Rishikesh and nearby places
review: Ram Jhula is Located 3km from Rishikesh. This Iron suspension bridge offers a spectacular view of the river and nearby places. This is a  connecting bridge between Swarg Ashram, Gita Bhawan and other temples with Sivananda Ashram. This Bridge is named after Lord Ram. This bridge was built during the year 1986.

title: Its ok
review: I had visited this place with my family.there is nothing but you got best view.there are two bridge at 1 km distance.if you have free time then you go there.if you want to enjoy rivercrafting then you go there.there is also ''Ganga snan'' place.but I think don't want your time to go there instead of to go other place in haridwar.but you visit first time to Haridwar then you would think to go there.thank you

title: Must visit Suspension bridge in Rishikesh
review: This suspension bridgeis located at drivable distance from the main city.

title: Quick visit is recommended
review: This is not as good as Laxman Jhoola but a quick visit is recommended. Basically connects two sides of the City located on the banks of river Ganga. Open for on footers and two wheelers.

title: A very Ordinay Jhula
review: Too many bikes are plying the Jhula , making it a very irritating place. The better option will be to take a ferry ride . The return journey cost you Rs.15 per head . enjoy the Jhula from the river Ganga.

title: a first stop at Rishikesh
review: The Ram jhula named after the Shri Ram, gives a magnificent view of the river ganga, the city and also a view of the people doing rafting in the river.

title: HISTORIC BRIDGE
review: My comments here will be the same as I have written in Lachman Jhula. This is a nice bridge. But the two wheeler traffic is a menace. It is a nuisance. One cannot stand or walk in peace across the bridge. The local authorities have to address this issue.

title: Awesome view of Ganges
review: A very religious and beautiful place in Rishikesh. Watch out for monkeys and touts. Dress up simple and indulge in a spiritual journey around the Ram Jhula. Buy precious stones and antiques at state Govt approved outlets.

title: Peaceful place with good eating joints
review: Must visit place with family or friends. Ganga ghat just at few steps away with very little number of tourist. Excellent photo shot points. Ram Jhula is 2kms away from Laxman Jhula. Vehicle on share basis available bw both places. You can get very delicious and fully served restaurants at Ram Jhula.

title: Bath of multitudes
review: You have to cross both bridges Lakshman Jhula and Ram Jhula. Don't bother the monkeys, they can be a bit aggressive. With such a crowd, even the cows can get a bit irritated. Just relax and melt with the local crossers. Very nice views.

title: Fair to pass some time
review: If you're in Rishikesh and would like a taste of the city, this is the place to be. A walk along the Ganges with all the Ghats and temples is a reflection of the city's ancient roots.

title: Shivanand Jhula
review: This iron suspension bridge is a popular tourist place. It was originally known as Shivanand Jhula . It connects Muni ki reti area which comes under Tehri District to other side which is Pauri Garhwal district . On the other side is Gita Bhawan , Parmarth Niketan , Swargashram and Beatles Ashram . Don't miss the Gany Aarti done on many places in the evening on Both sides of Ganga  river performed at different Ghats. If you stand still on this bridge , you would experience that the bridge is shaking/swinging which gives it the name of Jhula. You can cross river by motor boats which don't work only on rainy season. Very holistic experience.

title: Suspension Bridge Across Ganga
review: This is a very popular steel suspension bridge across the ganga river. Very popular with tourists. Must visit for a great view and an adventurous crossing.

title: Relax
review: Nice jhula with great environment of nature ..Peach n nature ...Nice ganga aarti we seen ...Great feelings

title: Must one to be visited
review: Great one. Amazing view and it was very popular too. A steel bridge. Nature and all things were looking good.

title: visiting
review: The place is a must. along the way u meet different kinds of people, people who are very very religious, no clothes on them, u c people washing i the Gangas, their beliefs the cows which are so sacred walking along and how the locals respect these sacred cows.

title: So cool
review: This bridge is awesome. Cows, monkeys, bikes, friends, family, music, every hour is different and it's crazy. The amount of people that cross and use it is staggering. I love it such a hub of life positioned over the amazing Ganga

title: One of the two Jhulas
review: I felt that Lakshman Jhula is better. But Ram Jhula is closer to the main town and Lakshman Jhula further away. I felt that Ram Jhula is smaller, I could be wrong. But neverthless it is good experience to walk on the hanging bridge.

title: Unique River Crossing Experience
review: The journey across Ram Jhula is at once chaotic, beautiful and exciting. A colourful mix of people from all over India and the world make the crossing every day. Great way to see the wild Ganga River flow. Interesting clothing and jewellery stores on each side of the bridge.

title: Unique and best
review: one of best places to be in rishikesh. Enjoy the scenic beauty backgrounds and river below. Mighty special and the feel of the air and holiness of place can take your breath away

title: interesting
review: It was interesting to see but we found the place quite touristy. It was a bit of a pain to negotiate a tuk tuk  from and back to the hotel. Some tried to" take us for a ride" so to speak and asked for an unreasonable amount of money.

title: Great
review: It's an amazing tourist place. The walk-away bridge on the Ganges is a suspension bridge. And there is plenty of greenery and peace in location.

title: A link across the river Ganges.
review: This is the first of the two hanging bridges across the river Ganges, which act as the lifelines, near  the shivananda ashram and Divine life society on one side and near the swargashram, Gita Bhavan and parmarth ashram on the other side. It was originally for pedestrians, but earlier cycles and now two wheelers also use it. Of course stray cattle also use the same.

title: Good to experience for once
review: There are two Jhulas (Bridges) in Haridwar, one is Ram Jhula and another is Laxman Jhula. They both are on Ganga River. We went through Ram Jhula. It is about 300 meter long one side. One bad thing that two wheeler also cross this Jhula making it difficult for the pedestrians.

title: Nice
review: I like walking along the Ram Jhula. The view of Rishikesh, and the hills is really nice.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Ram Jhula the oldest jhulla , Even Laxam jhull is old but not older than Ram jHulla. Awesome Spot , Must Go place

title: Ram Jhula
review: A must visit for people travelling to Rishikesh. View from the top is very nice. We all liked it a lot.

title: Best scenic view
review: Ram jhula is a main path over ganga river too connect people from both sides to cross river ganga

title: Good
review: It was a great place ......... i liked it very much ........ if any one want  to visit any place he should go to ram jhoola

title: Place to visit
review: Main attraction of Rishikesh. Place to visit. ensure to take good snaps with mountain and river on the back.

title: busy road @Jhula
review: From both the ends you could see many 2 wheeler are coming on the Ram Jhula. But in the middle there was no huge crowd, so you can take photos.

title: A must go place in RISHIKESH
review: Amongst all my trips, this was one of the most memorable places once I reached Hanumanji Murti in RAM JHULA campus. It looks like Hanumanji is really in front of us. Also, if you want to buy books related to religion, then GITA PRESS (Gorakhpur) has a very big shop in the Gita Bhawan campus.

title: Another bridge
review: Like the Lashman Jhua this Jhula is just a means of crossing the fast moving Ganga. It has tons of people and a large number of two wheelrs making is difficult for pedestrians.

title: A Swinging Bridge
review: Real Rishikesh lies the other side. if we come from Haridwar, for going to the famous Gita Bhawan or to Parmarth Niketan of Swami Chidanand Saraswati or to go to Neelkanth Mahadev, we are required to cross the Ganga and for this options are few. One such option is Ram Jhula which is also called Shivanand Jhula as at one side lies the Shivanand Ashram. It is in fact a rope bridge over Ganga which makes up down motion with footfall. Some  3 km further away is a similar rope bridge over Ganga called Laxman Jhula. Now a concrete bridge is in the making across Ganga will perhaps be called Sita Jhula. Ram Jhulka and Laxman Jhulas are landmarks of Haridwar.

title: Nice
review: We really had good fun and it is bigger than the Laxman jhula and you can actually feel the jhula thing... it is fully crowded but that adds more to the fun..

title: Crowded, still mesmerizing!
review: Walking by the road, getting down to cross the Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula, is an experience. The market, the people, the crowd, the noise, it all adds up to it. While crossing the Jhula, you may see people taking their two wheeled vehicles on the Jhula which is funny but that is the way it is.

title: Good
review: My family and I visited Ram Jhula.This is the good tourist attraction. Always good place to visit...

title: Overrated
review: Just a hanging bridge with nothing special about it. 2 wheelers are also allowed on it and crossing amidst them is a hassle.

title: Good place
review: It's around 2 km away from Laxman Jhula & is same as Laxman Jhula.There are many temples around it to visit.

title: Holly Place Ashram Geeta Bhavan - Ram Jula
review: Visted this place in the morning, For me visiting Geeta Bhawan is like a pilgrimage. Situated on the bank of holy ganga river can go through Ram Jhula, this Ashram provides all kinds of facilities to the people who come here for satsang and for free .It provides transportation to and from satsang venue,freee medical facilitiy,utensils,gas stove everything were available there, spend half day over there loved time,

title: Nice one
review: Crowded place but recommend place in Rishikesh. Nice Piece of Architecture. It is Smaller than Nearby Laxman Jhula.

title: Get KILLED or DEAFENED by two-wheelers
review: The maddening number and the maddeningly speeding & honking bikes & scooters on the narrow bridge will either kill you or shatter your ear drums, so walking on this bridge is painful to say the least.

title: Like Lakshman Jhula
review: Ram Jhula is like lakshman jhula but it remains less crowded. You can easily take a snap on the bridge. The view of flowing river of Ganga is awesome from this bridge. This place is 2 kilometers away from Lakshman Jhula and you can either go walking or take shared jeep which cost just 10 Rs.

title: Modern Bridge in an Ancient Town
review: The two bridges - Lakshman and Ram Jhula are the life lines of Rishikesh. The view at night is really mystic and it takes you to trance.

title: Overhyped
review: Ram Jhula is overhyped. Not recommended during peak seasons. Visit during off peak seasons. We spent 4 hours just for Ram Jhula.

title: Nice suspension bridge for pedestrians
review: Holy place for Hindu pilgrimage. Must see the aarti at the banks of the river near the temple during sunset. Plan to be there before 6 to get a good place to sit on the stairs of the river bank. weekends are usually crowded.

title: Nice visit
review: Right on top of the river Ganga, it looks incredibly beautiful. The crowd here is a proof how much people are fond of this place.

title: Very nice for sightseeing
review: very nice place to spend some time shopping and buying souvenirs for family and friends. there are a few good places to eat as well.

title: walk over the ganges and longer than laxman jhula
review: from the main road its very easy to access the ram jhula and walk across to the temple on the other side. u can stop for a pic or just watch the mighy ganga flow below.

title: Holy Bridge
review: Ram Jhula is the long bridge across Ganga River in Rishikesh. Here another shorter bridge called Lakshmana Jhula. Most of the people see beginning of Ganga River from here. Interested people can go towards Gangotri the real beginning.

title: The Champs-Élysées of Rishikesh
review: Yes, that's true. In this small not-far town you have a plenty of restaurants and activities where you can't find in the holy city of Rishikesh. Yoga western practitioners like to take a day off and head to this town to chat, shop, eat and have fun. This is not to mention the many Ashrams and courses you find in this sightseeing town.

title: Another Bridge in Rishikesh
review: Laxman Jhula is the land mark of Rishikesh.This 2nd suspension bridge of about 140 meter  has been constructed in 1980.

title: Two Wheeler menace
review: Very excited to cross the suspension bridge across the Ganga but the approach to the Jhula was very crowded. We expected people. Lots of people, but the shops and the two wheelers were unexpected. The two wheelers use the suspension bridge to crossover to the other side. They honk non-stop and the serenity and clamness is shredded to pieces by their raucous noise. The government should ban them.

title: Extremely crowded during the day
review: It's extremely crowded during the day it's a nightmare crossing it as locals are allowed to take their two wheelers on it and many tourist also stop midway to take selfie while people are pushing from behind, a bull also came on it which created a stampede like situation.

title: must stop at this place when u visit rishikesh
review: i am a telugu guy, and i have been to this place and most of the places in dehradun and himachal. and i find ram jhula more different and attractive because it is filled with lot of restaurants and every food item you want (veg). and the water there is always chill and beautiful.

title: The other favorite bridge
review: Walk from here to the next bridge and take the rout closest to the banks for the REAL Rishikesh experience

title: Very nice and sturdy!
review: When you visit Rishikesh you will surely visit Ram Jhula and Lakshman Jhula. The way to go to Neelkanth is also after crossing this Jhula. Jhula means swing and this bridge literally keeps swinging it is extremely sturdy. The view from the Jhula is amazing. Any way I love visiting Haridwar and Rishikesh. I love watching the aarti at the Ganges it is a surreal and ethereal experience.

title: Ram Jhula
review: This is also a bridge only as Lakshman Jhula, it is also visiting place if you go to Rishikesh thank you

title: Similar to Lakshman Jhula
review: It's beautiful and marvelous hanging bridge in the rishikesh. Similar to this a Lakshman Jhula is nearby.

title: Easy to cross the river
review: Ram jhula has made it easy for those who need to cross the river everyday. It has a very low space for a 4 wheeler to move so it looks crowded if some 2 wheelers try to cross river through it.

title: Beautiful
review: The mini beach experience near ram jhoola is totally worth the walk and the stairs that lead you to the jhoola. Its very setene n beautiful. Mostly untouched , water is quite cold and clean.The arti near the ghat was also quite good.

title: Adventurous crossing over ganga river
review: This is very adventurous crossing over ganga river and must to cross. There are many restaurants once you cross. Once at middle the bridge shake more. Enjoy the thrill.

title: Nice location
review: Nice location.great atmosphere. Lovely people...great view of river ..enjoyed  evening  aarti ...superb  feeling

title: this is the best yoga town in all of India
review: by far the best yoga town, I went to all the other towns this one had the least cars and the most authentic and very old history

title: Hanging bridge on ganges
review: This is the bridge parallel to Lakshman jhula which is built on Ganges near Ram mandir. This is also a  hanging bridge which itself is a marvel of architecture.

title: great view
review: you will like boating here.. it is same as lakshman jhula .. laxman jhula is in a village and ram jhula is in city

title: Mini version of Laksman Jhula, just a bridge but next to market, Chotiwala and Parmarth Ashram
review: Introduction: Built in 1986 after Lakshman Jhula which was built in 1929, this bridge serves the connectivity between Sivananda Nagar to Swargashram from west to east. This bridge is 750 feet wide and is located near to Parmarth Niketan which is again, another iconic landmark in Rishikesh.

title: Two most popular bridge in Rishikesh----
review: Travel here in march....i have no words to describe about the beauty of bridge and Ramjhula and most important ganga aarti on the ganges...i m so bleesed to be here...

title: same as laxman jhula
review: very near to parmarath niketen ..  cross over to parmarth Niketan to auto stand Ram jhula.... must visit place in rishikesh

title: A cable bridge
review: This is a narrow cable bridge across the Ganges.. crowded with people , cows and two-wheelers

title: weekend visit
review: excellent view. less crowded than laxman jhula, but too crowded on weekends. They shud remove the hawkers from the area completely.

title: Peaceful divine place
review: This place is away from all noise. One can experience spirituality at Ganga ghat. Really divine place. One must visit in Rishikesh.

title: The new bridge Ram Jhula
review: Ram Jhula is the newly built bridge as against the Lakshman Jhula. People usually cross over from Laksman Jhula, visit various temples and other attractions on that side of the Ganga, and then get back either by Ram Jhula or the ferry boat service which is available nearer.

title: Landmark point at Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is historically as well as the commercial hub of Rishikesh. There are many historical temples and ashrams around this place and is also the famous rafting point. The rafting ends here so you can book your rafting from here directly.

title: Excellent place with swarg ashram as a backdrop
review: You have to cross over this jhula or rope bridge for reaching neelkanth Mahadev..

title: Lots of srteet shops around Ram jhula
review: if you are a street shopper..this is the place..though we reached there on the eve of May 4th ..but still saw huge gathering of people for shopping....my experience with my small family was really very good.

title: Nice View
review: visited this Place  with family . crowded but Nice place with Rivver and enjoyed Ganga aarti in the evening

title: Average Bridge
review: It's an average walking bridge that gets very crowded with people, mopeds and cows. It is the best way to cross the river but nothing special.

title: Busy little microcosm of the Universe.
review: Busy area on hillside of Ganga. Nice place to catch ferry to cross river. Plenty of tuk tuks on the other side to take you in either direction.  Nice shops on hill side.  Lots of cows dogs  and thieving monkeys . Beautiful suspension bridge. Watch out for scooters they seem to have the right of way.

title: Attractive suspension bridge
review: It is a very well known suspension bridge to all Indian and overseas travellers. Nice place with full of scenic beauty around. Busy ghats with ferry service to roam in river Ganga. Some water activities also done here. Nothing to do just walk to cross the bridge. Or stand still on the bridge and enjoy the scenic beauty..

title: Very nice, deserves one visit!
review: Beautiful view this attraction has. It is always crowded full of both Indian travelers as well foreigners all the time. You should at least take a walk around it once to feel the magic of that environment.

title: Avoid it
review: It's full almost all the time. And for some reason motor bikes think they deserve right of way.  Not very safe. But necessary and yes you get a good view.

title: Good experience
review: I walked on the jhula during the evening. The view was amazing and very illuminating. It was a good experience. The jhula is pretty crowded all the times.

title: new bridge
review: this is a new bridge across Ganges and worth a visit , though a bit crowded there is not much to be done overall it looks quite good.

title: A must visit
review: Just as the name suggests like Lakshman Jhula Ram Jhula is also a suspension bridge with great views & when one visiting Rishikesh both the Jhulas is a must visit,.A walk down the bridge with views on either sides is a scene to watch for.

title: Less crowded than lakshman jhula
review: Ram jhula can be easily visited from lakshman jhula by public transport. Actually, Jeeps are there which charges 10 Rs per person. It is less crowded than lakshman jhula so you can easily take selfie here.

title: Most popular suspension bridge in Rishikesh
review: Popular large suspension bridge gives you some awesome photo opportunities. Bigger than Luksman Jhula.

title: Visit Mother Ganga
review: I want to share my experience with you. When i came to ramjhula I'm so excited to visit mother ganga. In ramjhula evening time is best to see mother ganga aarti at permarth niketan.

title: Excellent view of the sunset
review: It is situated right in the middle of the city therefore it is bustling with people. Over here too, commuters ply with their two-wheelers as well, making the space very constrained for people to walk comfortably. However, we were able to see very large fish in the river from the bridge. The sand banks below the bridge offer a very good place to sit and relax near the river. A good place to visit.

title: Lovely
review: i am in love with this place.  you will find everything which you are looking for.  hotel, restaurant, meditation, yoga, shopping etc.

title: Awesomeness
review: Great place. Lots to do. Ashrams everywhere to do yoga. Lots of perfect little shops for all your souvenirs.

title: Wonderful way to see Rishikesh!
