review: Walk over the Ram Jhula and explore either side of Rishikesh....then walk or take a tuk tuk to the Luxman Jhula and explore the other end. Luxman Jhula has lots of restaurants and coffee shops so plan accordingly.

title: Nice iconic bridge
review: You can walk from 1 end to another end and to Goa Beach and along the streets visit some shops..   There are kids there selling fish food for the fishes in the sea..

title: Iconic and too crowded !
review: Visited ram jhula earlier with my family . It's too crowded lots of two wheelers , cows on the bridge.

title: Must visit place in Rishikesh
review: Must visit place in Rishikesh, walking distance from Swargaashram. Nice view of Ganga river from Ram Jhula.

title: Mother Ganges and her two bridges
review: The Ram Jhula bridge is downstream some 2 Km's from its 'sister bridge' and the newer and bigger ( some 750 ft versus 450 ft. ) the two bridges are for me very defining parts of the town of Rishikesh.  You share the crossing with two wheelers, humans, animals and the ever present monkeys.  The latter are shrewd and can remove your boon rather quickly...beware.  The town is of course noted for its ashrams and there are lots to be found near the bridges.  Ram Jhula has the best location if you fancy a dip in Mother Ganges.  Just 5-10 minute walk upstream along the river bank will bring you to several nice spots, however the current in the river can at certain times be strong so you might want to just stay with a foot wade into the holy river.  You can carry on upstream from here as there is a small footpath leading into a larger road which eventually exited opposite the Police Station onto the main road.  Just keep Mother Ganges off to your Left and follow the path, road.

title: Horns should be banned
review: It is a super experience marred by a constant flow of 2 wheelers constantly blaring their horns at the loudest decibels level.

title: Must Experience Walking on this Bridge
review: Ram Jhula is a iron suspension bridge made in year 1986 to cross the river ganga. One should try walking in late night when no one is there and the wind is to heavy.

title: Not as interesting as Laskhman Jhula
review: The bridge itself is not as interesting. More interesting is to take the ferry boat at rp10 each person from the opposite bank.  Then visit the Gita and Parmarth Niketan Ashrams. Stay on till 5.30pm to witness the pudja at the latter.

title: Do not BLOW HORN, I am not a Tata
review: When they ban scooters, or at least ban sounding horns, I'll go back gladly. Why would you blow your horn at old ladies? Why do you treat the human body of another person as an obstruction to you? Are you such a raja you expect all the peasants to clamor out of your way? Must we also aver our eyes and prostrate? Everyone will get across the bridge, stop worrying.

title: Nice little walk over bridge
review: The bridge is definitely walkable, but you are sharing with others who are walking, on bikes or motorcycles.  My boyfriend was nervous feeling the bridge sway when motorcycles went by, but I never felt it.

title: Great Engineering during the British period
review: Built during the British period, this iron bridge is connecting two banks of River Ganga.  This bridge is not as much crowded as Lakshman Jhula.  It's comparatively a better peaceful place to watching River Ganga from the top of the bridge and enjoy a walk over the bridge.

title: Great views and good for shopping
review: It offers great views of the Ganga. Approach to the bridge also has some great local shopping options. You can even find some of the popular restaurants like Madras Cafe and Flavours nearby

title: The hanging bridge with a fantastic view
review: Ram Jhula is a hanging bridge, few KMs away from Lakshman Jhula and used by pedestrians and two wheelers to cross the Ganga. The sunset view from the eastern side of the Jhula is fabulous. People also use Ram Jhula to reach Parmarth Niketan to watch the evening Ganga Aarti. The experience of Ramjhula is overwhelming, very difficult to put it in words. It can only be experienced.

title: Love this bridge!
review: This bridge less busy than the Lakshman Jhula bridge. They're about 20 mins a part.   Beautiful views, less monkeys ;)

title: Lovely Views
review: Lovely views from the bridge. Just be alert, as it is busy with other tourists and locals. Try to stay to the side while taking in the views and taking photos.

title: A main attraction of Rishikesh
review: The bridge itself is an icon of the area but with a local g guide ( there is no shortage) there are a lot of hidden gems

title: More of the same
review: Like the Lakshman jhula, the Ram jhula is another bridge to cross the river Ganga and view  the aartis happening across the river. I would recommend visiting both as a circuit although both offer more or less the same experience. The two wheeler traffic and monkeys are omnipresent on both bridges it seems!

title: Beautiful Place
review: Nice Place In Rishikesh One of the "must visit place " when you are in rishikesh. Plan to visit in morning. Awesome For Rafting

title: Not much here. Lakshman jhula has a bit more going on.
review: This is basically Lakshman jhula lite. We did walk from Lakshman jhula to Ram Jhula and it was a very nice walk. However, the shops here are really similar to the ones in Lakshman jhula, there are just far fewer of them (maybe 1/10 the number). At least this was the case on the far side of the bridge.

title: Nice location
review: Laxman julla is comparatively far more know then Ram julla, but in rishikesh ram julla is far more better place to visit in comparison, with most of the known places like paramarth niketan, gita bhavan, kaki kamli vale Baba's ashrams, there are better entries, hotels etc.

title: Connects two banks of river Ganga
review: This is a bridge larger in size than Lakshman Jhula. It connects two banks of River Ganga.  The bridge is allowed for padestrians and two wheelers. We took a walk over the bridge. It was quite irritating to witness hawking on the bikes and have  bulls and other animals walking beaides you.

title: The Cleanest Place Ever
review: Visiting Ram Jhula was a nice experience. The place was clean, super busy at the time we visited and offered a lot of eating joints around.

title: Enjoyed bike ride over this suspension bridge
review: As this suspension bridge was less crowded than Lakshman Jhula, we used the opportunity to take up a bike ride over this Jhula and reached the other side of river Ganga.  We halted on the bridge mid way and saw the might Ganga river flowing below the bridge.

title: where the rishis and yogis live
review: Amazing sacred place by the ganges river. December through march lots of western ple come here to attend yoga courses, satsangs (discourses with masters). Lots of eateries, clothing and jewelry, religous trinkets, ayurveda and natural health shops, coffe shops and bakery, fruit and veggie vendors. There are lots of ashrams(monasteries) where pilgrims stay and worship. The suspension bridge connects both sides of ganga river. People motorcycles, cows are passing through (be attentive). On the other side of bridge you can walk along the shore to lakshman juhla and tapovan or go to taxi stand for a shared ride by jeep. You will not get bored here, plenty of things to do: study indian music, different massage techniques, satsangs with great masters, study advaita, astrology, ayurveda classes, lots of different yoga styles, rafting, excursions etc. The hills surrounding the valley are so beautiful. Its a truly wonderful place.

title: A must see
review: A suspension bridge with a difference for anyone from the western world, given its historic significance and the atmosphere.

title: Best place
review: Good place in the morning and evening time. i havevisited twice in the past month. A place for meditation and silence..

title: Ram Jhula - Another landmark of Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is a hanging bridge which is constructed over the river Ganga.. It is another landmark of Rishikesh. The scenic views around the bridge is amazing.

title: Another Footbridge
review: Like Laxman Jhula, Ram jhula is the second bridge in Rishikesh area which connects both side of the Ganges. Bikes are allowed but not cars.

title: Temple
review: Its a temple of ram.this is good templee and amazing for relax the mind and going to temple its Baooo..

title: Enjoyable
review: Do the full circuit walk. Cross the bridge here, either direction. Enjoy the view that it offers. Once crossed follow the road up to Laxman Jhula Bridge and re-cross the Ganga  and follow the Rd back down to Ram Jhula Bridge. It's a great walk.

title: Mesmerising aerial view of Ganges
review: Beautiful aerial view of the Ganges. A must visit place, if you are in Rishikesh. There are good eateries around, which makes it a good place for a post meal stroll.

title: Gita bhavan
review: It's gud for temple and they have sweet Shop  there I got Indian sweet and namkins it's 1 of the best shop for Indian sweets

title: Buzzing Area of Rishiesh
review: I travel to India a lot and this is by far one of my favorite places to visit. The area is buzzing with locals on the ganges, head there early to watch many families bathing. The bridge gets very busy however everyone is just doing there own thing so it's very safe both in the day and at night. Once over the bridge you will see many market stalls, perfect for haggling. The views surrounding the area are incredible.

title: Good place to visit
review: Many of the Rishikesh attractions are close by . We got dropped from n our car near Lakshman jhula car park area.

title: Must sees of Rishikesh
review: Its a very popular place and in the must see lists. The artis( rituals happen on the other side and its a treat to the eyes and ears.

title: Dirty and lots of touts
review: Visited this site to dip ourselves into the Ganges. Lots of touts and small children that hassle you.

title: Nice place and must see
review: This is place one should not miss.First use laxman jhula and cross over GANGESand take long walk on the other side of the river and return by crossing Ram Jhula

title: Marred by Pesky 2-Wheelers
review: Nice bridge, awesome view but marred by inconsiderate drivers on 2-wheelers with their speed and incessant horning.

title: Nice experience
review: We had good experience over here, Ram Jhula is still in good condition, one must visit this place if you go to Rishikesh

title: Ram jhula
review: Basically ram jhula means it's a suspension bridge   named ram jhula which was build by govt for transportion by foot for locals from both the banks over river ganga.

title: Nice surroundings
review: This steel rope hanging suspension bridge over Ganga in Muni ki Reti 3 km off Rishikesh was built in 1986. The view of the river from the bridge is awesome but unfortunately you can not quietly enjoy the place due to two wheelers crossing the bridge continously and also due to the crowd of selfie hunters. Otherwise nice place and must see.

title: View
review: View from the Julha is amazing, but have to be very careful while walking as the motor riders are very rough

title: Avoid the bridge and take the boat
review: The bridge really should be a foot bridge. It's spoiled by all the motorcycles and scooters pushing through the crowds. Just below the Ram Jhula parking is a ghat where you can take a boat across for 10-15 rupees. The area has numerous shops, restaurants, ashrams, etc.. It has really become way too commercial to suit me.

title: Nice bridge to go to the other bank of Ganga
review: Two wheelers are a bit of disturbance for walkers, but that is ok. Nice walk over the bridge with Ganga flowing udner your feet

title: The Famous Ram jhula on River Ganga
review: Ram jhula is a very famous bridge over river Ganga in Rishikesh...If wind blows you can feel that the bridge moves...Ram jhula and laxman jhula are famous in Rishikesh...

title: Visit to Ram jhula
review: Very similar to Lakshman Jhula. A lot of monkeys on the bridge. If you see one you may want to avoid the second. A lot of public using the bridge any hour of the day. Avoid carrying food and water to save you self from a monkey attack.

title: Interesting Place to visit in Rishikesh
review: A must visit place is Rishikesh. One can get a glimpse of local religious culture here. Peaceful atmosphere adds to its aura.

title: Peaceful Walk
review: It is always very good to be there and to cross the bridge in early morning and evening with the beautiful views of Ganges & Ashrams is what which makes this place amazing. There are many Ashrams near to the bridge where one can learn Yoga & Meditation and can attend the evening Aarti (Pray) at the great Ganges which is very peaceful and nice. A must see place.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Good place to visit in morning time. avoid after morning. lot of crowd & bike after morning. we are stuck there 10 Min.

title: Replica for Lakshman Jhula
review: The suspension bridge is similar to Lakshman Jhula. The distance between the 2 bridges is around 2.5KM, and is better to be covered thru Share Taxi or own vehicle.

title: Ganga Arathi @ Parmarth Niketan
review: It is a great show at Parmarth Niketan ghat. The singing of keerthans is mellifluous and soul stirring. Well organised, the show is a stopper.

title: Ganga View
review: You can see the good scene from the Ram Jhula, we visited in the evening which was aarti time. We also went for boating in the ganga river.

title: Feels heavenly
review: Been to Rishikesh more than 10 times and each time I love the trip across Ram Jhula. The view of the Ganges on both sides, Swarg Ashram ahead and Sivananda Ashram behind with lush green forests around just gives it a wonderful feel.

title: Bridge fun
review: This is far better than Lakshman Jhula. It's less crowded and offers a better experience of the bridge. You can walk down to the bank of the river and spend time there too

title: Great experience
review: This is the best feeling after Lakshman jhula.. this is the same but yes it swing alot compared to The same. I would sugggest if you haven't experience please go ahead and travel on this jhula

title: Connector
review: Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula is connectors that are part of your daily city travel. When you walk first time across Jhula its full of excitement as you can enjoy top view  Divine Ganga. Good selfi spot.

title: Sacred feeling
review: I visited Rishikesh very first time nd visited jhula. I was feeling calm n tranquil in my heart. Must visit place.

title: View the high mountains, magnificient Ganga below from a swinging bridge
review: One can watch huge fishes in the middle of Ganga from the jhoola. Most of the time the jhoola is crowded with pedestrians and motor cyclists crossing to either sides.

title: Jhula with all food cafes around!
review: We went to this jhula specially to have good food after crossing it. It is same like Laxman jhula it is also an iron suspension bridge. And you feel  like you are on a swing due to suspension. Nice experience. This bridge leads to many cafes, basically this area is cafe hubs. You should visit this bridge to have good food.

title: Nice healing atmosphere
review: I had been to this place recently. This ghat has its own significance. I kept meditating at this ghat in the morning and evening. It was really a wonderful experience. It had given me a totally different feeling It's very natural...One has to visit this place.and it's surroundings. A walk at this place fills your mind with serenity....As a traveler and health & yoga conscious person, I feel that places like this really make us feel recharged.It awakens your inner yogi too. That's the reason why many yoga centers were concentrated here. It's worth revisiting.....

title: Beautiful Bridge
review: Its and iron suspension bridge which is constructed across the river of ganga. Standing in the middle of the bridge gives a good feel.

title: A must to cross river
review: When going to the other side of rives, its a must visit place to cross. Though it becomes crowded in the evening, the breeze there at centre of the bridge soothes you!

title: If you can shut down the honking you are fine
review: A place to get away and focus on the view of the river, the Green Ganges, the Holy site, this is a place to just take a break and take it in the moment. While crossing the bridge, you will encounter many foot traffic, sadhus, cows, monkeys and bikes going along. Then come down to the ghats, there are access everywhere, dip your feet on the water and wash away your troubles.

title: love the walk....
review: laxman and ram jhula are the two walking bridges across the river ganges in rishikesh and there is a lot of buzz around these bridges with hawkers selling their wares, food stalls, eateries and restaurants. overall a brilliant hangout place

title: nice suspension bridge
review: nice suspension bridge over the ganga. be wary of shared motorbike and scooter traffic on the bridge as you're walking.

title: Beautiful
review: A beautiful view. Ram jhula is longer than laxman jhula. One can take boat to get to the other side of the jhula and then walk back on the jhula thereby enjoying the boat ride and the view from the jhula.

title: Good place to eat street food
review: If we go in the evening it is a good place to eat but however It very noisy and the vehicles honk a lot and you might even be tempted to head back to your hotel

title: Ram Jhula
review: A little congested with vehicular traffic, and people crushing/touching each other. But, an interesting experience.

title: Scenic view
review: The view from top of this bridge was very nice with the mountains in the background and blue water flowing under. The bridge sways a little and hence the name jhula which means swing

title: Similar to Laxman Jula
review: This bridge is also very similar to Laxman Jula and if you are in Rishikesh for a day or so you are bound to cross the bridge.  Though made of iron, the bridge keeps a little sway which earns it the name Jula.  A very good view of the Ganges below and the backdrop of the mountains makes this place a must visit location, except for the chaos on the bridge.  Upkeep and maintenance can be far better given that thousands of tourists visit this all the time.

title: Ram Jhula is also good place to visit & spent time, being with Nature.
review: Ram Jhula is also good place to visit & spent time, being with Nature. You can have good Selfies & Photos from the Place.

title: Bigger than Lakshman Jhoola and equally noisy
review: Traffic on the bridge is a real let down although if you are in Rishikesh, you would not want to miss this place.

title: Great view of the Ganges from here
review: This is a bridge across the river Ganga in Rishikesh. You will have a great view of the river from here. You can take a boat from one side to the other and take a walk back over the bridge. You will have to share the bridge with people, motorcycles and cows :)

title: Good to walk on Ram Jhula
review: Great View and divine feeling to walk on Ram Jhula. Never miss this if you are nearby in Rishikesh. Corwded during holidays but on week days its great to go without rush and take good snaps.

title: Good shopping more choice less expensive
review: Compare with Lakshman Jhula, here price is less expensive and more choice to shop. However, not much choice for western food. However, cross the bridge really make me tired.  Too many ppl and motorcycles and monkeys.  You will never have a lonely feeling here which should be a selling point.

title: The BEst place to take a walk at Rishikesh
review: You can access the Jhulla from either side. One side connected with Markets & small food joints other side connected with Ram Jhulla Parking & Chotiwalla Restaurant. The same side connected with a small road going towards Paramarth Niketan. Take a lazy walk & enjoy the beauty of Ganges. Also can avail small Ferry from just aside of the Jhulla to cross the Ganges.

title: Another attraction
review: Two wheelers are allowed on Ram Jhula and the traffic goes to and forth. Below the river looks so serene and beautiful. A must visit.

title: GREAT VIEW
review: It is similar to Lakshman Jhoola... Its a bridge to cross the river... The view of the river is great...

title: Ram Jhula, A Cable-stayed Bridge over the Ganges................
review: Ram Jhula connects the two banks over the river Ganga at Rishikesh, one bank being the Muni -ki -Reti area, and the other being the Swargashram area. It is one of the busy jhulas at Rishikesh the other being the more famous and older Laxmanjhula and an unending passage of man,animal and small vehicles can be witnessed all through the day over the Jhula. The evening arati at various temples  situated at the bank of the holiest river of the Hindus, near ram Jhula, is the main attraction of Rishikesh,the gateway to the Garhwal Himalayas. However the arati at Swargashram is the grandest of them all . Exploring the numerous places of reverence,the lanes and bilanes  criscrossing the Jhula can take a whole day and you will simply forget to remember how the time has glided by.

title: Very nice place
review: A beautiful strong Jhula which has great restaurants on one side and is close to parking on the other side. Nice view from the centre of the bridge

title: Amazing construction.. too crowded
review: Ram Jhula is usually the main bridge which is used by all the locals as well as the tourist to cross over the Ganga to the other side. As this is the first bridge for all the tourist and majority of the Ashrams located on the other bank nearer to the bridge, all the people they prefer taking this route making it very crowdy. As two wheelers are also allowed on the bridge and the constant honking by them makes the experience a bit miserable. Over all the experience of the suspension bridge is quite awesome and the view of the River Ganga is superb from the bridge. Beware of Monkeys and occasional Cattle on the bridge.

title: One of its kind !!
review: Just walk on this bridge and jump. You will experience the bridge swinging caused by your action. That's something. Liked it.

title: Cable Bridge for pedestrians
review: Nice place to visit. at one end of the bridge there is parmarth niketan aashram which is famous for its ganga aarti in evening. plan to visit it in evening time.

title: Pleasant
review: Ram zula is almost same as Laxman zula.you can visit flea market around it.They have clothes,wooden artefacts and different sovuneirs which you can carry back home.you can easily spend 2hours in that area without getting bored.

title: Nice but busy
review: Nice but motorbikes should not be allowed on the bridge...it would be much more pleasant. You feel like on a highway.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Ram Jhula s an iron suspension bridge situated at Muni Ki Reti in Tehri Garhwal district in Indian state of Uttarakhand.

title: Amazing
review: Walking around ramjhula....the view of the ganga ....will make you feel blessed....although it is a bit congested now ....still a must visit place for me

title: Amazing
review: It is near parmarth ashram. U can cross river ganga through this. The view is awesome. The nly thing which i didnt like that bikes and scooties also use this and dont know wether it is legal. I think must be allowed only for the walkere

title: Hanging bridge
review: My experience to went through Ramjhoola was amazing...However at  day time, the bridge is full of tourist and bikers/scooty, at night it is totally different. Standing at mid of this bridge, you can feel the wind flowing in river direction. It seems we stand here whole night.So, little avoid on holidays at daytime and a must to visit at night time.

title: Must visit!
review: What a crazy place, full of monks and cows and monkeys, this place contains everything India offers and is and absolute must for tourists!

title: nice jhula to be on for a widest view of Ganges near Urban Sip Cafe. A must visit plcae
review: Whenever you are in Rishikesh, a must visit place to go is Urban Sip near Ram Jhula from where you can Ram jhula and widest view of Ganges.

title: Glance of mini Indian, as well as world culture, in a small stretch
review: As this bridge connects, main (business) town with other small town situated on the other side of the River, this bridge in most of the time, will be filled not only with the localities but also with all types of Indian & foreign tourists . And hence, at any given time, one can see mini world (with their (changing) culture), on this bridge. Most of the time, as this is bridge over crowded not only with pedestrians but also with verities of vehicles; it is difficult to stand at a point, for few minutes, to have the glimpses of this bridge or its surroundings.

title: Heaven
review: Just as title says. 9 days not enough. Either chillout, yoga and meditation or go walking or adventure activities. Many surrounding places to visit. People just so special, it felt like I returned home.

title: Picturesque view!
review: The bridge connects both the sides of Rishikesh. Seeing the bluish green river flowing in between the mountains standing on the bridge is a beautiful scene.

title: Panoramic view of the ganges
review: One can get a shared auto from haridwar and get down at laxman jhula. Cross the jhula, walk 2 km and cross the ram jhula again. Jhula is made in such a way that the whole weight is on the upperside. Therefore is moves a lot when people are walking on it. Worst is scooter and bikes are allowed on the jhula which makes it even more chaotic

title: Another marvellous piece of Architecture to have graced the Yoga Capital of India
review: Whenever I get to visit Rishikesh, which is quite often throughout the year. Taking the Kids out for the Steamer Ride and coming back through Ram Jhula has been a sure-shot activity, which everyone loves to do :).  The Walk is such a calming influence that We always look forward to get lost in the serene beautiful landscapes aroud..

title: nice experience
review: unique experience to walk across this bridge though it is very crowded with lots of monkeys,cows and two wheelers.You can also take a boat across for Rs 10 and cross over to the other side.There are numerous shops worth checking out selling curios,books,artifacts etc,however bargaining with them can be very tough

title: So relaxed
review: Beautiful India seen from this bouncy bridge. Gorgeous sunsets, plenty of picture opportunities, less monkeys/tourists then Lakma Jhula. A great walk to do on the way to the Beatles Ashram.

title: Spritual
review: Spritual and serene. Totally loved sitting by the ganges for hours and reading books. Would hope to get my friends here.

title: Amzing Swing Jhula-Ram Jhula
review: Cool breeze was hitting my cheeks at night while i was with my friends only. A different feelings altogether and then we had coffee at Urban Sip, Near Parmarth Niketan. The best Coffee House in the City. Highly recommend coffee cafe.

title: A must visit
review: It's not only this bridge but the scenic view at the other end that gets you on this bridge.  If it's raining or breeze the bridge swings and makes u feel like a trip on Indiana Jones.  Day and sunset views are lovely and I sincerely recommend to cross it in night for an experience.  Bring ur camera to take pics on either sides of the bridge

title: Must go
review: Visited to show Ganga to kids. Nice and clean. However , the two wheelers should be banned from going on the bridge. Be careful of them if you decide to walk on bridge.

title: Jai Ram ji Ki
review: its a beautiful bridge over the ganga river which offers a pristine view of the ganga waters. its a popular destination for tourists flocking to rishikesh

title: You can feed fishes from Ram Jhula
review: There are local kids selling flour balls to feed fishes from Ram Jhula. Once you throw a ball in the river you will see fishes pile up to eat it. You can enjoy viewing sun set from Ram Jhula.

title: Beautiful view
review: Noises ,pollution but it's fantastic.

title: Very dirty, full of cows and lively
review: This area has many ashrams, small shops but PLENTY of cows. One has to be careful walking as the place if full of cow dung!

title: The bigger suspension bridge
review: This suspension bridge is bigger than Lakshman Jhula, but not located in that strategic location as Lakshman Jhula.  Ram Jhula is located at a place called Muni Ki Reti which is about three kilometres from Rishikesh.  Less people visit this place and hence we found lesser crowd here. We spent quality time over the bridge here watching the mighty Ganges.

title: Jhula across Ganga
review: The jhula is situated in Rishikesh connecting Tehri and Pauri areas. It was constructed by Shivanand trust which has a large Aashram on Tehri side .

title: A mordern version of Lakshman Jhula
review: This is a mordern version of the famous Lakshman Jhula but still the essence and the beauty of the place has been kept intact. The view from the bridge is good and enjoyable. But this place remains crowed and even 2 wheelers are allowed to pass through it which makes it a little clumsy.

title: GREAT WALK
review: Walking across the bridge makes me floating in the air. Its so great as moving by thousands of human, as usual busy incredable India. The morning and evening walking and standing on it gives you great view and feeling WITHIN. Never miss it.

title: Sightseeing and Souvenirs
review: Interesting touristy sightseeing place. Enjoyed the excursion here while three days stay near Rishikesh.

title: Swinging sensation
review: The Ram Jhula is a marvel....such a narrow passage across the two banks of the ganges but a cemented bridge that swings as you walk.....people two wheelers all walk across this together.Though a little congested....the sunset from here is amazing on the Ganges. Leads you to the Geeta bhavan Parmarth Ashram and the famous chotiwala restaurant that has gastronomic delights to offer.

title: Ram jhula
review: Same as laxman jhula this is also a hanging pillarless bridge build over ganga around 5kms apart. Excellent views.

title: AUTHENTIC
review: hey,if you have the option and the opportunity to sleep there,do that,

title: There always a nice reason to stop and take a picture
review: On the bridge there are always so many people that cross and unfortunately even motorbikes and the bridge vibrates and you feel suspended as well. There are monkeys that play long the cables and locals and tourists love to take pictures together

title: Must visit place in Rishikesh
review: This is very old and must visit place in Rishikesh. It has a great spiritual connection with this place.View around is awesome.

title: Similar to laksham jhoola
review: Again, as mentioned in my review of laksham jhoola, it's just another foot bridge, crossing river Ganga.

title: cross the river in himalyas
review: In the midst of Himalayas, on the holy river Ganges is this bridge in the name of Lord Ram. It's best to walk down this bridge instead of using any vehicle. View from the bridge is majestic.

title: Local immersion.
review: Crossing it is a total local immersion because you'll be in the middle of people, cows, monkeys and motorbikes.

title: religious
review: Rama jhula is also an iron suspension bridge over the River Ganga. It was built in 1980 and replaced the old rope bridge. It is located in a place called Muni ki reti in Rishikesh and it connects the Shivananda ashram and Swargaashram. It is also a site of numerous temples and it is a very congested area with narrow road and is usually alot crowded.

title: Heavy traffic in day
review: It is almost same as the Lakshman jhula. It is very busy and is almost full during daytime and evening. As two wheelers are also allowed to pass so it kinds of not very peaceful. But walking in this suspension bridge at night is one of the best feelings. The cool breeze of the ganges and the music of the flow of river is breathtaking. Best place to talk with your friend or loved one. ;)

title: good time pass...
review: this place is on everybody's itinerary who visits rishikesh full of colorful crowd from around the world, the bridge itself is a feast for eyes.

title: good place to visit and buy souvenirs
review: while the ganga arti at parmarth ashram is over rated, the rishikesh triveni ghat one is more original and spiritual yet you can eat at chotiwala here and buy churans.

title: no place like this!
review: Ram Jhula is a mixture of everything the human existence is about. Smells, noises, dirt, people, dogs, cows, monkeys, food, shops. Either you love it or you hate it. i happen to love it. one can roam around, walk down the steps to sit by the Ganga, people watch, shop, and/or eat. The choice is yours. Check out the Aarti, every day at sundown and If you are looking for good quality Malas  (or jewelry) at a fair price i recommend Bhakti jewelry shop, my fav.

title: Nothing Special
review: A normal hanging bridge. Nothing special. But now associated with Rishikesh. Very near to the Ganga Aarti place. Main market area. Good roaming place.

title: Sightseeing
review: The legendary chotiwala is here, good traditional Indian thali lunch. Must try for everyone and a part of the local culture.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Bustling place of Rishikesh.. It is nearer to the Gita Bhavan and Aarti Ghat and many Ashramams. Lord Rameswara Temple is here.

title: A little less scary than Lakshman jhoola
review: This is again a hanging bridge located at Rishikesh near to Lakshan jhoola. But on the contrary, it is a little less scary and more stable than lakshman jhoola. Both these bridges run parallel to each other.

title: Peaceful serene!
review: The walk on this bridge gives such a good feeling. You could see the deep river, feel the cold breeze. Amazing it is.

title: heaven on earth
review: the bridge was made during kumbh mela and till date it has maintained it integrity. towards the end you can feel the breeze and swing of the bridge hence called jhula

title: Amazing Divinity
review: A wonderful bridge across the holy river... Feel the positive vibrations of the mother Ganga and the cool breeze which rejuvenates your mind while on the bridge.. !

title: great bridge
review: & amazing view of Ganges. But you can't stop since bikers are constantly blowing horn. Another great place going awry

title: Yoga
review: If you are here to practice yoga, this is your place. Ram Jhula is full of ashrams where you can practice all the yoga styles, surrounded by the atmosphere of this holy town.

title: Less crowded than Lakshman Jhula
review: We visited Ram Jhula after visiting Lakshman Jhula. We were fortunate enough to see that it was less crowded than Lakshman Jhula. It was lot easier for us to walk over this bridge and quickly get to the other side. The experience of walking on a swinging bridge, below which Mother Ganges was flowing, was great.

title: Place for spiritual awakening
review: A nice place to have a look at nearby temples, yoga classes (turned into a business model) few good restaurants & do not forget to visit Geeta Bhavan & Geeta press book store

title: interesting really to visit
review: Good to walk around the area. A nice temple and big ashram is here which is interesting to walk around. Nice restaurants in the area.

title: Good holy place
review: We hired a guide who explained us importance and significance of place. Since ram and lakhman...killed ravan who was a brahmin...they had a brahmahatya sin in their name for which they had come here to do prayashiitt...some temples are unique here....u can buy spatuc stones .Lakshmi tantra and rudraksh beads from govt shop here.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit in rishikesh with family and friends too its a long bridge over river travelling over it is a grate experience

title: Spend time on the bridge and enjoy the nature
review: Very nice walk on a swinging bridge, especially it was raining a bit when we were there and the river had quite some flow.

title: Just another bridge
review: Ram jhoola is another bridge that helps to cross the river. It is built strong and one can take a two wheeler on the bridge.

title: Overrated
review: We were staying at Devprayag and went down to Rishikesh to attend the Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Mission. The google maps showed us a way which was not recommended by the localities. So we decided to ditch google maps & stick to localities guidance.

title: Must  see  this  place.
review: We  went from this  side of the Bridge and returned.  Must  do when you are in  Rushikesh.  Dont miss it.  Both  the Bridges are  nearer to each other.

title: Another landmark of Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is another landmark of Rishikesh (along with Laxman Jhula). It is an iron suspension bridge is built over river Ganges to cross the river. It is in the year 1986 much after Laxman Jhula is built.

title: Iron Suspension Bridge over Mighty Ganges
review: Ram Jhula is an iron suspension bridge situated at Muni Ki Reti near to Rishikesh built on River Ganga. It is a strong bridge connecting the banks of Ganga.  Two Wheeler are allowed on the bridge.  We enjoyed a nice walk on the bridge watching the River from the bridge.  We were occasionally troubled by bikes honking and bulls moving freely on bridge.  Crossing the river by walking over Ram Jhula was a nice experience.

title: Too crowd
review: Very beautiful views, but hard to enjoy with that many people and scooters crossing at the same time, blowing horns is all I can remember.

title: One of the second great attractions in Rishikesh
review: You can visit the bridge anytime of the day and night, gives a good view same as Laxman jhula. Great viewing and photo clicking location. Place where you can have sugarcane juice at just Rs. 10 very big glass.

title: Mr vaideeswaran Chennai
review: It is located approximately 5 km from triveni ghat. It is worth & safe taking dip in paramarta niketan for which u have to cross the ram jhula. U have geeta bhavan. & Other attractions near paramarta Niketsn. Remember we have to walk a long from other end of jhula to reach paramarta Niketan as auto rickshaws stop well before jhula. I think there are boat service to cross the river also.

title: Fabulous bridge
review: Very similar to Laxman Jhula, and a beautiful suspension bridge. There are markets on both sides with small shops, though roads are wider and cleaner around this area compared to Laxman Jhula. You have to jostle through the crowd to cross the bridge, along with bikes, scooters and cows. The view beneath the bridge is amazing. You can travel between both the bridges using the jeep service.

title: Good place
review: Similar to Laxman Jhula, it has second best arti at Rishikesh after Triveni Ghat. Nice view and local market nearby

title: It's a bridge.
review: This is a bridge. Simialr to Laxman Jhula, okay views. Designed as a footbridge used by motorbikes, cattle, and pedestrians alike. The bridge is also very busy through a lot of the day.

title: Beautiful view
review: Absolute must visit. If you are in Rishikesh you can't miss it. Either side is worth a visit and crossing it is an experience too.

title: Busy unique bridge
review: Ram jhula is a unique long bridge, must visit in Rishikesh. The connecting lane is normally busy with a lot of shops around. The bridge is usually busy as well with a lot of people walking across and even two wheelers using the bridge. Across the river you have Chotiwala, Gita bhavan, Parmarth aashram..

title: Amazing Bridge
review: Ram Jhula is a suspended bridge across the majestic Ganga. It serves as the best tool for the people to access both sides of the banks. It is also used for transporting goods on hand pulled carts, and bikes. You can have the best picturesque view of the river Ganga and the banks around.

title: Suspension Bridge named after Lord Ram
review: This suspension bridge is just like the Lakshman Jhulla, slightly wider .One gets the same feeling while walking on it as one gets on the other.This  bridge appears to be sturdier  .It is nearer to the  parking lot on the city side as well as to the Geeta Bhawan ,Triveni ghat and all the Ashrams, Yoga and Meditation  centres ,last but not the least the Chotiwala restaurant on the other side of the river.Since this is a pedestrian bridge Authorities should prevent two- wheelers driving past the crowd.

title: Munni ki reti
review: It"s similar to Luxman Jhula but is nearest to Gita mandir and Vanprastha Ashram and Parmarth Niketan.

title: Icon of Rishikesh
review: No trip to Rishikesh is compete if you do not see this iconic bridge Ram Jhula over the river Ganges

title: Quiet less popular than laxmam jhula
review: Similar to laxman jhula..

title: Worth one time visit
review: We had gone to this Jhula around 8 in night. It is a hanging Jhula and you feel it swinging little bit when you cross it. People can take their scooter and bikes too through it.

title: Nice view
review: It gives a nice view. Looking at it from away gives a picturesque view. Amazing eating places all around. Look for trip advisor choices and you wont be disappointed.

title: Poor
review: Old people should avoid Ram jhula. Total chaos as motorbikes\scoooters are passing by on a tiny bridge. No safety for anyone.

title: Shopping center of Rishikesh
review: Here you will find the best shops and restaurants across the Ram Jhula bridge. But take the ferry boat for Much more Ganga charm. Also walk all the way down river on the Swarg ashram side to where Maharishi trained the Beatles in Transcendental Meditation. It's one of India's most remarkable ashram sites.

title: Too much crowd
review: You will find too many people on the bridge. It has a beautiful view of Ganges and triveni ghat. They should stop allowing two wheelers on it as it makes commute difficult on bridge.

title: Must visit
review: Second iconic bridge after laxman jhula. Can cross and go to Swarg ashram or to iconic original chotiwala Though do not expect much at chotiwala. You can stand on Ram Jhula and watch maa Ganga and feel great inside(soul)

title: best place to see
review: Ram jhoola is situated very close to Rishikesh town around 3 kilometers before laxman jhoola .The traffic to laxman jhoola is quite high and lot of traffic jams , so to avoid this peoples cross ganga through ram jhoola . Most of the visiting places like geeta bhavan, chotiwal, parmarth niketan, kali kamli wale baba, swargashram etc are near ram jhoola only.The bathing ghats are also plenty and clean at ram jhoola.Thousands of rooms to stay on ram jhoola and beautiful scenery of himalaya.

title: BIG Nooo
review: Don't ever think of going at Ram or either Lakshman jhula.. the place is crowdy n stinks... There is nothing to attract you.. rather enjoy ur stay in hotel or do some other activities

title: Ram jhula#cradle of ritual#crowds#two wheelers
review: Must walk...a crowded bridge that sways like the name suggests....the swirling river below..selfie point......only marred by the persistent flow of noisy two-wheeler traffic that almost mows you down.

title: Time Old Suspension Bridge
review: If you have come to Rishikesh for a trip, Ram Jhula will be one of your destinations, inevitably. Whether you are interested in Rafting or roaming in the local market or watching the Ganga Aarti at Rishikesh, you will have to come to Ram Jhula. It has the famous Chotiwala too and numerous other restaurants.

title: Meet after 1 year❤️❤️❤️ Love this place
review: It was one of my best day ...we meet again after year,this place is always Lovely will be visiting again every week...love to watch different people...Everything In here is Amazing as GOD created

title: Awsome experience on Hanging Jhula
review: The most busiest walking bridge over ganges to connect Rishikesh & Swargashram near parmarth niketan.

title: Scenic Suspension bridge - Tourists & Pilgrims
review: bridge connecting both sides with a scenic view..take selfie..enjoy both ride..walking distance to taxi stands,boat rides, Swargashram,Parmarth Niketan,Geeta Bhawan etc. Across the bridge ..way to laxman jhula and Neelkanth Mahadev temple (25 Kms- take taxi from here)

title: Must see in Rishikesh
review: The Lakshman and Ram jhulas are must-experience in Rishikesh - there's not much to do apart from just walking across, but it's worth walking down the most iconic suspension bridges you will see anywhere, with the Ganga flowing under. Coupling a visit to Ram Jhula with a meal at Chotiwala's Restaurant is a great idea.

title: ram jhula
review: Rishikesh is city with poor infrastructure. Crossing from the highway side to the other side of ghat is a logistical nightmare. Ram jhula plays an important part in bridging the two sides. Always crowded, people are jostling each other to cross over , along with two wheelers.....But is a different experience

title: Ram jhula
review: its a nice place to visit, not much different than Laxman Jhula...but a lot of eating joint...and street vendor. good for some photograph, Parmarth ashram is nearby and you can attend evening Ganga Aarti..

title: Bridge actually swings a little
review: This bridge is a masterpiece along with laxman jhula. You can actually feel it swinging a little bit while walking on it. One can enjoy nice view of Ghats n Various ashrams on the bank of river ganga. This bridge is usually crowded and local people even take there two wheeler through this bridge to reach the other side. This bridge will take you to the taxi stand for neelkanth mandir.

title: real Rishikesh
review: If you wanna see the real Rishikesh with all the Ashrams and several places for Ganga Aarti (morning and evening ceremonie at the Ganges) you have to visit or stay at this area. There are a lot of restaurants and shops too but not as much as at laxhman jhula.

title: A great art
review: Ram jhula is a bridge to cross river ganga it is very long in lenth and a great attraction to see in rishikesh it is a very old attraction and have crossed it many times but everytime we cross it the ferling is always the same crossing this bridge is a time to be enjoyed

title: Nice place to hangout
review: Its a nice place to hangout during the evening time or you can have a dip in holy Ganga river, there are lots of ghats around it. There is a famous Chotiwal restaurant across the bridge, dont forget to taste the food. There are 3 Chotiwalas restaurant now around the Ram jhula, the orginal one is across the bridge,but there is a catch, there are two adjoining restaurant of 2 brothers, the original is the old one and with full of customers.

title: Have fun in holy spirit over the mighty ganges
review: This is second hanging flyover mighty and holy ganges after luxman jhula( hanging flyover). One enjoys the mighty flow of holy ganges. He or she can have full glimpses of ganges and its holy water. Water of holy ganges never get spoiled over the period of years and years.

title: Ram Jhula also known as Shivanand Jhula
review: Ram Jhula is a unique hanging bridge that is very helpful to cross from the Rishikesh town side , taxi stand and Ashrams like Sivananda Ashram to the other side, where Swarg Ashram, Gita Bhavan , Paramarth Niketan and other older institutions of Rishikesh are located. You can visit all of them in a day trip and also return to the Rishikesh town side through a ferry boat. The experience of crossing Ganges river through this Ram Jhula and a ferry ride is one of a kind experience

title: Over crowded
review: The bridge remains overcrowded because of Selfie enthusiasts and bikes.

title: ram jhula
review: looking at the location of this jhula near to so many ashrams..the authority should plan some other alternative along with it...as it is over crowded,,the only good thing is when you  cross this in morning with a great view of gange....

title: Nice View
review: You can get the great view of river while crossing the bridge.I honestly find the Lakshman jhula and ram jhula identical. Try to avoid this place in summer's afternoon as everything is hot. A maximum thirty minutes are enough for this place depends upon the weather condition but you will like this place.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Visited it to go to famous restaurant Chotiwala for the lunch .

title: VERY INTERESTING HOLY PLACE
review: It isa Rope way bridge constructed to cross  the Mother Ganges to reach the other side of the Rishikesh.  There is another Bridge named Lakshman Chula  on the other side hence this bridge is named  As " Ram Chula" Rishikesh is the Gate way to Himalayan Pilgimage places such s Badrinath , Kedar Nath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri.. Rishikesh is famous for Aurvedic medicines and Yoga .   It is a good  palce for meditation since during ancient period hindu saints came here for meditation . Adventure sports available. The river Ganges can be crossed by way of Ram Chula by walk or  By thrilling Boating on the speedy ganges water.  Many temples around the ganges. It is a holy palce for hindus.  Very close to Haridwar around 25 Kms .

title: Excellent views, beware of honking bikes
review: Beautiful views from the bridge across the mighty Ganga. The views are brilliant especially around sunset. However beware of he honking motorcyles, cows, dogs and plenty of monkeys. Plenty of shopping as well on the Swargashram side.

title: Nice bridge on Ganges
review: Serves as link for two opposite sides of Ganges at Rishikesh. Has shops on both sides for shopping and eating. Nice place to spend some time. View is marvellous and the breeze is exceptional.

title: Indian Side of Rishikesh
review: You would enjoy the hustle and bustle on this popular place. you may feed fishes from here. Lot of vendors will offer fish feeding here.

title: Nice view of river ganges and hanging bridge for people
review: A bridge basically for pedestrians, however also used by two wheelers.  Gives a good view of triveni that and connects old city across the river.

title: Go for the view
review: Go because you want to cross over to the old chotiwala restaurant (though they have a deluxe branch on this side of the river too now) but stand there for a while for the view.

title: Peaceful, try to cover this place in the morning when there is less traffic
review: Ram Jhula - major attraction of Hrishikesh is toured by lot of tourists. Suggest to cover this place in the morning when there is less traffic - the view of rising sun from the hills with the holy river Ganges descending from the mountains is a treat to the eyes and soul.

title: It's another bridge ...
review: Another river crossing that can be very busy with tourists and local motorcycles. Interesting views. Good place for selfies.

title: Fun, Hot, Lots of Peps
review: Love this place for shopping. Lots of little stalls. Motorcycles are allowed and really shouldn't be.  It is too crowded and narrow to accommodate people, cows and motorcycles. Be sure to stop into the honey pot for tea, Wi-Fi, and air-conditioning!  Also fun to take the little boat over from Rishikesh and back. It is only Rs.15 for a round-trip.

title: Good place
review: This is a better Jhoola :-). I liked the Ghats around Ram Jhoola. The shops and ashrams are much better than Laxman Jhoola.

title: Its just a stroll.
review: Not an attraction from my perspective since its a normal pedestrian bridge. Pretty crowded and frequent visits by 2 wheelers honking too much. Btw its the only way across the river so you will have to cross it.

title: The spirit of Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is a 600 ft long hanging bridge on the River Ganges. You have to leave your car in the parking area which is little bit away and take several stairs to come to the ghat.

title: Very nice bridge
review: You can connect from one corner to another corner, in between the river is flowing. Ganga the great river. Both side there are temples and Ashram. Such a holiness in it. Its a must see attraction there.

title: Good experience to walk above the Ganga
review: Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula are a must visit when you travel to Rishikesh. we visited the Ram Jhula, which basically takes you over the river Ganga to the other side, which has a plethora of temples that one can visit. it is a good photographic location as well

title: Nice place
review: Similar to Lakshman Jhula.. Nice place to visit. Nearby attractions are the temples and food at Chotiwala

title: Go experience the shake!
review: Only two wheelers allowed on this column-less bridge, make sure you walk on it without banging into them.

title: Nice Experience
review: Ram Jhula is very nice place to visit. It's mostly used to cross river ganga to reach other side. You can have great views while crossing the bridge.

title: incredible
review: amazing sceens from here lovely surrounding full of life the peoples here heaven on earth truly wounderfull

title: nice view
review: nicely maintained,clean and good view of the river ganges.ghats are there too.

title: Good view of Ganga
review: This place is attractive because of its nearby ashrams. Swarg Ashram, Laxmi narayan temple, Parmarth Niketan, Geeta Bhawan etc are near by Ram jhoola. You can take a sharing jeep from Laxman jhoola to reach here. Enjoy lunch at chhotiwala and do taste local fruits like Ramphal 5 pcs in 20 rupees...Good ghats to take dip in cool water..

title: good view
review: If you go at night it will offer a good view. But again it is scary to walk since it will keep swinging..

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit n roam around. Ganga view is awesome. Sit some time on the banks place your feet in cold water. You will be recharged.

title: Enjoy the swings on the holy river Ganga
review: Fortunately visited on a windy day. The tremors on the bridge were incredible.This place looks like heaven on earth. Ideal for Spirituality and not for worldly enjoyments...

title: essential part of Rishikesh
review: The location is less dramatic than its brothers. However the same amount of bikers disturb the peace. You can not really visit Rishikes without crossing the bridges...

title: A wonderful visit
review: Ram Jhula..its a engineering marvel..a hanging bridge right over the majestic Ganges...the rope bridge is used by people to walk and even 2 wheeles who ride at easy through the narrow bridge. Its a plesant walk filled with thrill when u walk across the marvelous Ram Jhula

title: A fascinating bridge
review: This pedestrian bridge which is also used by two wheelers, connects the two sides of Rishikesh town across the Ganga. It was built about 30 years ago, but seems to have been repainted recently.

title: Rishikesh Experience
review: Ram Jhula is a vital part of Rishikesh. AQgain, to me it was scary walking over the bridge but it is a essential part of your Rishikesh visit. To experience the life on the other side of the River you have to do it. Lts and lots of things to do. Rishikesh in total caters for every ones tastes. From high adrenaline sport, to shopping and dining.

title: A similar bridge as laxman jhula
review: Just as I wrote wrt Laxman Jhula, this bridge too is an overrated tourist attraction now. It's purpose is truly functional, rather than anything else now. The mythical story behind it, is quite difficult to visualise, with all the steel and iron it's made of.

title: Nothing much to do
review: It is attractive just because of it's name. Lot of pilgrims visit the place considering it as sacred. Apart from that, government has allowed vehicle to cross the bridge which has become inconvenient and less enjoyable.

title: Two of its kind
review: There are two swinging jhula pul at Rishikesh. Ram jhula is one of them, other being the Laxman Jhula. When you stand still at one place in the mid of the Jhula, you will feel the swing. Also when the breeze is at higher speed, feel will get rich.

title: Ram Jhula
review: Visited Ram Jhula for its historical beauty. The Ganga may not be very pure here due to large number of people taking a dip here. However the place is photogenic

title: Nice place to take a stroll
review: This is major place where you could take a stroll and cross the bridge and reach the other bank of river Ganges. while returning you can return by ferry.

title: Same as laxuman jhula
review: It not necessary to visit if you already visited laxman jhula because its same and there is nothing difference. Bridge made on river ganga so that we can cross ganga. You can not cross your vehicle on bridge.

title: Must visit
review: Another suspension bridge along with Laxman jhula, not sure which one of the two is older though. Has all the characteristics of solid british engineering and still working

title: Better than laxman jhula
review: Less crowded and better than laxman jhula. Good place to visit when u r here. River ganga is always peaceful. Good piece of architecture and design. Historic place to visit.

title: Good place to visit
review: It is a good place to visit.

title: Family Place
review: This is more of a family place.

title: One of the attracton
review: Good shopping place. with all variety of stuff. very lively place. must visit to see the beauty of ganga and the jhula, especially in the evenings.

title: Pleasant and peaceful surrounding
review: Certainly a pleasure to visit this suspension bridge. Holy place all around surrounded by yoga and religious center. We enjoyed the multiple boat rides as it was quite short which cost 15 RS only per trip. Near by parmarth niketan is a must visit for its evening Ganga Aarti and incredible ambience!!

title: Must visit in Rishikesh
review: A must visit in Rishikesh, preferably in the evening just before the aarti time to see its glory...great view but quite a walk to access it...two wheelers a big nuisance otherwise a  good experience and safe, the view of the ganges from the bridge is worth a watch.

title: Lots of fun
review: It gives you a high to walk up and down the bridge atleast once. Not only do you feeling like walking on an adventurous terrain but also you feel spiritual and breathtaking.

title: Good but could have been better
review: The place is bustling with people but is poorly managed. Local authorities must do something about it. Its a lively place on the banks of River Ganges and one can sit for hours by the riverside and feel the divinity all around.

title: You need to experience the suspension
review: The Ganges flows majestically underneath and Ram jhula does its magic lullaby. This is something which has to be experienced and not something that can be told in words or through pictures. If you are around this place make sure you get this experience. Enjoy the Ganges in its one of the purest places.

title: Hanging bridge like Luxmon Jhula constructed much later
review: With the rise of devotees and popularity of Geeta Bhavan on the left bank of Ganges this bridge was constructed on the same design of Luxmon Jhula, named after his elder brother Ram.

title: Nice place to be in a good weather
review: Its similar to Laxman Jhoola but Arti in the evening adds to attraction. If the weather is good its lovely. Standing there and enjoying the wind.. Priceless..

title: same as laxman jhula
review: both bridge are of same height and design. nothing is diiferent more than few things.

title: Charming Foot Bridge
review: Lots of fun to cross, especially if there are monkeys about.  Families and individuals use this bridge to cross the Ganga River to visit ashrams any time of day or evening.  Occasionally there are motorbikes crossing too that you have to be careful to avoid.

title: evening at ram jhula with great arti at parmarth nikatan ashram
review: great place. jhulla view soothing. but bikes on jhulla are nuisance. many ashrams like geeta. parmarth niketan. on each ashram ganga arti is routine in morning n evening with musical support and sound of ganga river. all are beyond imagination. so must come place for everyone.

title: Peace of mind...
review: amazing feels around Ganga... listen the sound of river with silence. you will feel happy to see jhoola. don't forget to food the fishes

title: Nice area
review: It was nicer than the laxman jula in that there was a little less noise from scooters ... It led to a crowded area near the temple ashram . We enjoyed walking around here

title: Perhaps a little less crowded than Laxman Jhula
review: This bridge is an efficient way of getting across the river if that's what you have to do, but apart from that, there's not that much to it. The area is perhaps geared more towards Indian tourists than Westerners (as compared to the surroundings of Laxman Jhula), so the vibe is a little different. Worth the trip, I suppose, but nothing special.

title: AMAZING
review: Everyday i had to walk across this bridge to go on the otherside for my satsang with mooji baba in swatantra ashram. Its so catching early in the morning with the strong wind blowing across which freeze me but i enjoyed each step of mine on the bridge. Ganga just flow as HER daily rountine which such beauty. Its all surrounded with beautiful mountains. its so heavenly..

title: Ram Jhula
review: Ram Jhula is the first bridge to Rishikesh, after you roos it you will find all the temples and restaurants, it is defiantly the indian side of Rishikesh and its more hardcore with all the noise, my recondition is to sleep in the Lakshman Jhula area (second bridge)

title: A nice place
review: It's a bridge named after Shri Ram. Rare gemstones are sold on either side of the bridge. The local food served there is very tasty . The serene atmosphere refreshes one's body,mind and soul. Visit the place for a wonderful experience.

title: Beautiful view for the night aarti
review: We climbed the Ram Jhula in time for the night aarti in Rishikesh and it was stunning, if you can get there before sunset and stay til the aarti it is magical!

title: nice place, simillar to laxman jhula
review: ram jhula is  nice place , similar  to laxman jhula  , must visit place in rishikesh.

title: Holiday
review: Once must visit ram jhula and laxman jhula in rishikesh to experience the awesome view of the Valley and flowing ganga river down below....

title: Suspension Bridge on the Ganga
review: Ram Jhula is a suspension bridge across the Ganga mainly for pedestrians but used by two wheelers and cycle carriages bringing a lot of congestion. But then congestion is every where in this part of Rishikesh. We used the bridge on our way back from the Ganga Aarti.

title: Nice suspension bridge over the Ganga !!
review: Just like the Lakshman Jhula, the Ram Jhula is another suspension bridge over the river Ganga. The two bridges are about a km away from each other and form a major attraction in Rishikesh.

title: Very good
review: Ramjhula is also known as Shivanand Jhula and connects the two banks of the Ganges. Walking on this bridge over the Ganges is an amazing experience.

title: Gets to the heart of Hinduism - something magical ...
review: Sitting on the banks of the mother Ganga hearing the bells, and chants from the many temples and ashrams as the sun sets,  is really a wonderful thing to do in india -

title: The happening place in Rishikesh
review: The Laxman jhula was the original suspension bridge over the Ganga in Rishikesh , built in 1929. But many years later, in

title: Good for religious travelers
review: Ram Jhula and surrounding areas are good for religious tourism and buying Aryurvedic and Handicraft stuff. There are small food shops too, but didn't look too clean to eat there. There is a Parmarth Niketan which have a different deities and they also organize Ganga Arti every evening.

title: A bit disappointing
review: The bridge is very impressive but the area around it not so much. Preferred Lakshman Jhula by a mile for atmosphere. Found a nice walk from Ram Jhula to Lakshman Jhula, about a mile or so past lots of ashrams.

title: Nothing much.Laxman jhula is better
review: PURE Religous place in surrounding. Can be left in trip.

title: Recently renovated
review: They've repainted the bridge and it looks marvellous at night.

title: nice view
review: if only people were not driving bikes and cows would not use it, I would have given it a 5 star rating. the view of the ganges from the jhula is lovely.

title: Must go to Bhakti Jewelry Emporium!
review: Ram Jhula is a neat place to walk around and do some shopping. Amazing street food (get the potatoes!!). Bhakti Jewelry emporium has beautiful jewlery for very fair prices. A must see! Beautiful handmade mala necklaces.

title: Cleanliness
review: I stayed at Hotel Pure Inn near Parking Ram Jhula. The cleanliness along the embankment  amazed me. A distance of almost 1.5 to 2 kms along the embankment was totally litter free. Even the entire area across the Ram Jhula, which included the market place, to my surprise was almost garbage free. It was a pleasure walking thru the area. I am sure this cleanliness drive will definitely attract more domestic and foreign tourists.

title: Nice place to visit
review: It is almost similar to Laxman Jhula on river Ganga. The bikes and stray animals on the bridge are little iritating. The walkway near it is kept in excellent condition. There are a lot of shops and road side restaurants nearby. One can also cross the river by boat instead of walking on bridge. One can cross the bridge and reach famous Parmarh and Beatles Ashram from here. A must visit in Rishikesh.

title: Tiny but nice
review: Good food to be found, commerce and cups of tea. Pleasant shop owners where we found a shop that was open to socialize without purchase. We've made the trek there 3 days in a row. It also has a great shiva ashram on the far side with an amazing view from the top

title: Take the Ferry Boat
review: This is the most happening part of town, especially in the evening when the aarti pujas are in gear. But don't always use the bridge. The ferry below the bridge is a charming alternative, especially on a hot day. The beaches just upstream from the bridge are the best in town.

title: Just took a walk across.
review: It is just a bridge so I don't understand the fascination and why it is listed as a top attraction?!

title: A different experience
review: Ram and Laxman Jhula are the main attractions of Rishikesh. Similar structure and similar purpose, they are just about 2 KM apart. A hanging bridge to cross mighty Ganga, where people cross on foot while locals use it for bicycle and motorcycles too.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Ram jhula is a suspention bridge over Ganga River built in 1986. It connects Rishikesh and Swargashram Area. Swargashram is a spritual tourist destination in Rishikesh. Mist visit.

title: A beautiful view of ganga ghat
review: A must for every  visitor in Rishikesh. Just below the police station is the Ghat where a person can witness the ganga aarti (worship of river ganges) . A beautiful light and sound show that commences at 5.30pm and concludes by 6.15 pm

title: Pilgrims
review: This area is popular for the ashrams. Parmanth Niketan in particular as it hosts the nightly Aarti. Very popular and another bridge.

title: Very much like Laxman Jhoola, more crouded...
review: Its is a busy rope-way for commuters to cross the Ganges & similar to Laxman Jhula.... In use by pedestrians, scooters, motorcycle & cyclists alike.... One should be careful of the monkeys as they seem to snatch any suspected food items you may be carrying....

title: Swing..
review: Just 2 km ahead downstream, at Muni-ki-Reti, is another suspension bridge built later connecting the areas of Shivanand Ashram on the east bank and Swargashram on the west.

title: nice
review: Very much like Laxman Jhoola, more crouded..

title: awesome expreience
review: Everybody knows about Laxman Jhula but Ram Jhula is not so much famous though it is same as Laxman Jhula but adds some thrill as foot rest appears to be somewhat weak in comparision to Laxman Jhula. Below the Ram Jhula people can enjoy the fast flowing Ganga  River.

title: Beautiful bridge
review: A suspension bridge on the Ganges where you can see many monkies. The sunset viewed from the bridge was very fantastic

title: Same as Lakshman Jhula.
review: This is another tourist spot which is same as Lakshman Jhula. The view of the river Ganges is from the bridge is good. But go either to Lakshman Jhula or Ram Jhula as both are same.

title: Historic visit
review: This is an important place in the area and has historic and religious significance for the people there. On days its not too crowded its fine but they allow two wheelers on it which I think is not advisable

title: Best location
review: If you want shopping, atmosphere and enjoy a good cup of coffee - this is the most vibrant part of Rishikesh! Many accomodation is set back off the main thoroughfare so don't let this dissuade you. Loved it!

title: Twin of Laxman jhula
review: This suspension bridge is  at a short distance from Laxman Jhula and is almost similar to that.the place is another attraction.

title: Nice place
review: The most important visiting places and temples in Rishikesh are in Ram jhula (not in Laxman jhula). Lot of places are there to visit.

title: Another Suspension bridge. But the streets on the other side of Ganges is worth the visit
review: While you visit the Shooping lane and list of ashrams on the other side of Ganges, do try the street side food joints too. Hot biscuits and Aloo Tikki is mouthwatering. The boat service near the Ram Jhula offers one-way and return trips. Which is also worth than walking all the way on the suspension bridge.

title: Sight to behold
review: During sunrise & sunset, this place has a magical aura. All you need is to sit quietly at the river banks & soak in the beauty.

title: Glitzy Arti
review: very well organised Arti by the ganga at Parmarth Niketan Ashram.  Nice to go an be part of remember to respect india clothing and how you dress attending ceremonies

title: Another attraction of Rishikesh to view Holy Ganges
review: Ram Jhula connects Rishekesh to Swargaaashram and lovely place to view river Ganges. good means of transportation for  the visitiors.

title: temples and view
review: amazing temples.. heaps of them..great place but shopkeepers try to sell expenisve without any ethics..

title: walk over the bridge is a must
review: the chaos that takes place on the walk across is amazing - motor bikes are allowed to ride amongst the pedestrians - everyone is in a constant hurry

title: Ram Jhula
review: After Crossing Ram Jhula There are too many Yoga asharam to meditate for...Foreign are attracted for the same....Chotiwala Hotel there is good to hang out...The feel at Ram jhula while crossing is incredible...Calm ..Beauty...Clean...Peace...In short Nice Place in Hrishikesh to Hang out...

title: Beautiful Bridge With Ghats On Both Sides
review: This is the 2nd of the bridges in Rishikesh.

title: LOVELY PLACE TO visit AND Chill.
review: great place to visit. I always visit laxman jhoola.my life entirely changed after going to ram jhoola and bhootnath temple.

title: Beautiful view and experience
review: Less crowded then Lakshman jhula. Suspension bridge is scary and good fun. The bridge is a beautiful piece and the view of Ganges and mountain is breath taking. Must visit place. Also have indian food at chotiwala for indian or tip top Resturant for western food.

title: Good
review: This is basically a bridge which connects two sides of river Ganga. Since this bridge shakes when one walk, it is named as Jhula (Swing). being situated at a holy place, it has its spiritual importance also.

title: One of the best place in Rishikesh
review: The city of Rishikesh lies on both sides of RIver Ganga and this bridge help people in moving from one part to another. The views are nice and the usually there is a nice breeze flowing. Good place to spend 30 minutes and for a few photo clicks.

title: Used this Suspension bridge to reach venue for best Ganga Arti in Rishikesh
review: We stayed at Divine Resort in October 2015 and my daughter wanted to see best Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh which takes place near Geeta Bhavan. We had to cross River Ganga using this Suspension bridge that has been constructed by Indian Government only in 1986. The other bridge "Laxman Jhoola" was built before Indian independence. Children were really excited when we crossed the bridge to reach other side of River to see the well known Ganga Aarti. Only one thing worried me, motor cycles and scooters are allowed to use this bridge and some of them were driving very fast, people with children need to aware of this hazard when using the bridge with young children.

title: Hanging atop Ganges
review: A suspension bridge over Ganga...The view of the parallel mountains, clear stream of Ganga, river rafting all are eye-soothing

title: Beautiful place and very Calm.
review: Ram Jhula Bridge is very nice place to visit near Muni ki Reti, very nice market nearby and ganga aarti in the evening.

title: Centre of Ashrams in Rrishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is one of the pedestrian (+ motor bikes) suspension bridges across the Ganges upstreaam Rishikesh. On both sides of the river you find famous and infamous ashrams (big) and kutirs (small) , i.e. living places of holy med: sadhus. Plus all the paraphernalia of a major pilgrims place. Visit Parmarth Niketan ashram and its famous aarti (fire)-ceremony at sunset on the river banks, the Beatles' Ashram. Dress decently, be modest.

title: This bridge over the ganges needs major renovation
review: The local officials need to replaced this bridge, dangerous at nite without flash lite, loaded with people and many many motorcycles make it very unsafe. Beware

title: Swing and thump on Jhula thrills you
review: its a half century old bridge made from strings, wires and little concrete.  Advised to take an auto if you are shuttling between Ram jhula and Laxman Jhula

title: Superb utility
review: This jhula provides amazing connectivity to Swargashram from the rishikesh haridwar highway. You can also use bike on this but not car.

title: A must visit !
review: It is must to visit at your tour to Rishikesh. I would suggest to hire a bike and travel all the places around Rishikesh. Ganga at this height gives very beautiful view.

title: Nice one
review: Lakshman and ram jhoola are the same in almost all the aspects. Both give a stunning view of the formidable mountains and the holy Ganges. It's really good to cross these bridges and go to the various ghats for bathing in the river. But both the jhoolas need repair and maintenance. Also the two wheelers spoil the charm ...

title: Must Go
review: It is more or less similar to Laxman Jhula. Only difference is that it doesn't move much. You can go by car here . There is ample of parking space. Nice view of Ganga and perfect for photo freaks :)

title: thrilling with bike ride
review: have tested with a bike ride over this rope bridge, had a great experience over this great utility structure at river ganga. excellent one..should not miss

title: Busy spot
review: Full of pedestrians and pushy/noisy motorcycles. Thankfully the bridge is narrow - no cars. Nice views of the river and beach.

title: second bridge over mighty ganga
review: Not as famous as laxman jhula but a much more clean and photogenic bridge. Just after crossing ram jhula one will come across a famous restaurant on the left hand side. Chotiwala. One should try the veg delicacies there

title: Crossing the Ganga over a hanging bridge!
review: There are times when walking over the Ram jhula was just a way to get across the Ganga. But there are also times when walking over Ram jhula is much more spiritual. Someone told me that if you stand on the jhula at 4AM, you could feel the swing  due to the wind and it is a wonderful experience. I never got around to do it, but I feel the best time to enjoy the walk is before 6AM, when it is quiet. One would be able to stand in the middle of the jhula to soak in the beauty of the Himalayas and the Ganga  at that time. But after 6AM, crossing it becomes tedious with people and two wheelers (and their continuous honking) both ways, and there would also be tourists stopping in the middle of the jhula to take pictures, stopping traffic altogether!

title: Suspension bridge t Rishikesh
review: Build in 1986 parallel to lakshman hoola, is another bridge to cross river ganga. one can enter through lakshman jhoola and exit through ram jhoola, gives excellent view of river ganga.

title: Just like lakshman jhoola
review: Just an average bridge similar to the lakshman jhoola. The shops around the bridge are good and cheap as compared to other places in rishikesh.

title: Ram Jhula : Feel the judder
review: This attraction is over river Ganges used to cross the river and is a landmark of Rishikesh. It's robust structure which allows people and 2 wheeler automobiles to cross the ganges. It's mostly full with commuters also you can see rafts beneath you in the river.

title: good place to stay while in Rishikash
review: this is the place for backpackers / guest house , travel agence for tarcking and nice café to see sunset on Ganges. it you are after Yoga place or self exploring this will also fit.

title: A Must See Landmark of Rishikesh
review: This Suspension Bridge is located about 5 Kms from the Hotel we stayed in (Hotel Ganga Kinare), and near Tribeni Ghat. It is a narrow bridge where apart from pedestrians, only Scooters and Motorcycles are allowed. No Cars. The bridge sways in the wind and is a great place for photography.  On the other side of the river are a number of Temples. One can go to the other side by walking across the bridge or by taking the motorised boat services (Rs 10 per person). We preferred to walk across. Keep around 2-3 hours for this place including visiting some of the temples across the river.

title: Offers good view of valley and Ganga
review: This bridge is for people and 2 wheelers crossing Ganga from one shore to the other. The boat ride offers return journey for a cheap Rs.15 per trip. This bridge is walkable distance from Parmarth Niketan Ashram. Both the sides offer famous Ganga Aart in the evening. The market on the Parmarth Niketan Ashram side is interesting.

title: nice
review: ram jhula is the most saught after location ain rishikesh and a must visit in any case as a busy bridge

title: good
review: View from Ram Jhula is excellent This bridge is walkable distance from Parmarth Niketan Ashram. Both the sides offer famous Ganga Aarti here

title: Not for tourists
review: Ram jhula has no mythological history behind its construction. It is very crowded and not for tourists. It's connected to some good temples like Parmath whose Aarti is nice and can be attended by the tourists.

title: Walking through Ram Jhula is a great experience
review: Nice place walking through Ram Jhula is a great experience.... must have a nature walk from Ram Jhula to Laxman Jhula on the left back of river...

title: A Nice Place
review: Locacted in the green foot hills of Rishikesh, RamJhula is a big attraction for tourists. It's nothing but a hanging bridge over the sacred reiver Ganges. Across the river, there is swargashram and Gita bhavan - two excellent places of piece and spirituality lovers. Gita Bhawan is excellent from religious point of view. Books of Gita Press

title: Lifeline of rishikesh
review: This hanging bridge actually links the 2 banks of river Ganges. Two wheeler and pedestrian are only allowed can to move. Sunset from the bridge is spectacular.

title: Just a bridge
