review: There is nothing special in this bridge, just a lot of small shops and the crazyness of crossing a walking bridge with bikes around you.

title: Nothing less than Laxman Jhula
review: Must visit. Less crowded than Laxman jhula. Lot of temples on the other side. Lots of restaurants and hotels. Can be a problem for people who can not walk much.

title: Big name nothing great
review: Its just a bridge ... Too crowded and d worst part is that 2wheelers are allowed so it make it very difficult to walk post sunset.  The roads are not well lit . There are no good views nor any thing exceptional to see here .

title: Ram jhula- an iron suspension icon
review: This s located near swarg asram.. it's a iron suspension bridge named after bhagwan ram.. right over the river Ganges.. the Ganga aarti occurs at this place..it's also one of the major landmark here and it's flooded with tourists.. be careful when u click your pics using a phone or camera as if it slips it will directly fall into river..

title: Just a bridge
review: Just another busy and buzzling bridge over the Ganges in India. Rather a means of getting from point A to B than a sight worth to see.

title: Bridge suspended on Cables. Exciting..!!
review: The Ram Jhula is one of the main attraction of Rishikesh. And surely it is. This bridge across the Ganges is quite an excitement to be. It should be around 500 mts in length and is the connecting point from main road to  the other side of the Ganges. One can fell the swings and the jerks on this bridge since its suspended on cables. My kids enjoyed a lot when we crossed the bridge.

title: Thrill of Walking on a Suspension Bridge, Two Wheelers Zipping By & Feeding Fishes
review: Ram Jhula - The second most famous iconic landmark of Rishikesh.

title: peaceful
review: i visited this place in June 2015. Everyone must see the place in over life its simply claim and peaceful place.Evening time stay on Ganga river its relay best feeling aver...

title: Crowded Laxman Jhula Bridge
review: Lakshamana Jhula is a suspension bridge in Rishikesh With a length of 450 feet and at a height of around 70 feet from the river..Across the banks of river Ganga is the famous Laxman Jhula bridge which gives us an awesome view of Rishikesh . This place is crowded with people ,monkeys cows ,bikers ,foreigners  and many shops lined up once u cross the bridge .The market near Laxman Jhula is highly recommended for people interested in handicrafts, ancient woodwork, gems and precious stones, clothes and other items.Across the bridge, located on the south bank are the tall Trayambakeshwar Temple and Swarg Niwas.Shop for souvenirs and knick-knacks to take back home.

title: A MUST for those visiting Rishikesh...
review: This is a must... both the Ram and Laxman jhulas are the main attractions in Rishikesh... stunning views up and down the river and of the city...

title: The swinging bridge on river Ganges.
review: Ramjhula is a bridge which connects Muni Ki Reti to Swargashram. In the winters u can feel the bridge swinging with gale. Stand in the middle n u can see the fishes in the river.

title: Feel the freshness of Mighty Ganges.
review: Ram Jhula is the best suspension bridge in India. Must go place to have good walk over mighty ganges. Feel River Ganga at its best. You may also choose to feed fish

title: Great view of the mighty Ganga
review: Great place to get some of the best photos of the river.

title: Spiritual Quest!
review: To attend aarti at Parmarth Niketan crossing the lenghty Ram Jhula is enevitable,bikes,public jostling to cross both ways.

title: ganga arti at rishikesh
review: fascinating view of the Ganges flowing in full flow and the julla swinging to its tune abruptly very beautiful view of the ganga aaarti at parmartha niketan

title: Ram Jhula
review: We took the boat to cross the river in the evening, and came back from ram jhula. Frankly speaking, it was an awesome experience crossing it during night time as the wind would simply mesmerize you. It has local shops all along the two sides. Better not be late than 9 pm, as the place starts becoming desolate. Awesome view during day time.

title: Amazing Bridge
review: Looks like lifeline of Rishikesh for people across the river. Its very nice bridge. Gives you a different feeling as it swings very slowly when on it. Always crowded with lots of people, bikers crossing the river. Really worth to be there once :-)

title: Beautiful!
review: beautiful. the energy on the bridge is so peacefull. you must go and stand on the bridge in the early morning .

title: Beautiful bridge but beware of Monkeys!
review: It is the new Bridge. Strong and swings a lot. The bridge is long. Walking on the bridge feels fun as the bridge swings. It is fully protected. But beware of Monkeys. They are very aggressive. They grab everything so put the phones in the pockets.

title: One of the two famous bridges of Rishikesh
review: This is one of the two famous bridges in Rishikesh,in Uttarakhand.

title: Relaxing
review: Its a new one unlike Luxman Jhula which was built in 1940s. Ram Jhula is built in 1980s. Must have seen it in many indian films also. Having a good breeze standing on Ram jhula makes your day

title: Identical structure if compared to Laxman Jhula
review: Ram jhula and Laxman Jhula both are same but famous one is Laxman jhula due to near by market. Also from laxman jhula people go to Nilkanth mandir also. some one can spend 2-3 hours near River..

title: nice
review: Its shaky when moving on jhula but pleasant to see ganga mata from the top. view river rafting passing by

title: The main drag of Rishikesh
review: Ram jhula at any given day is crowded and if you happen to be there on a auspicious day, just getting in and out of the place becomes a problem. It is crowded and touristy. Great for getting acquainted with Rishikesh and what it represents to people of India

title: NICE
review: similiar to laxhman jhula , connects to few temples on other side of river ganga .take a guide costs rs 100 , He will explain about the historical significance of all places and temples.

title: One must have a ride on ram jhulla. Have a blissful,journey to witness mighty ganga during raining seaon
review: Wonderful. It is possible,only due to the blessings of lord shiva. We should carry food for fishes to feed them from jhula orbfrom ghat.

title: A must see in Rishikesh
review: i visited this place in July 2015. It is about 25kms from Haridwar and about 3-4kms from Rishikesh city centre. It is a hanging bridge on River Ganga and swings when heavy wind blows. It offers a great view of the Ganges in the midst of the surrounding mountains.

title: Ram Bridge
review: The bridge looked majestic over the Ganga. It looked as in pictures .We walked across the bridge,the locals go bikes and scooters.

title: Walk to Experience
review: At Rishikesh one can not miss the experience of talking a walk on the Ram Jhula.

title: ram julla
review: Ram Julla is near geeta bhawan in rishikesh, it actually swings if the winds are high, I have seen the old bridge as well.. A nice place... and there is  Famous restuarant called choti wala.. do try it

title: Crazy bridge
review: Busy all day long and chaotic because of the combination of monkeys, cows, motorcycles and full of people, it gives an outstanding view of the Ganges and the activities that happens in the river side.

title: JUST BEAUTIFUL but beware of bikes and monkeys
review: If any Uttarakhand Tourism official is looking at my review I would implore him to do something to ban or at least restrict biking on this beautiful bridge ( during the peak seasons at least). The view of the river flowing down below surrounded by mountains all around is just awesome but the fun of just being there and soaking in the beauty all around is marred by the constant fear of being knocked down by a 2-wheeler. A lot of monkeys are also there but normally they leave you alone unless you are carrying eatables in your hand.

title: This is an iron suspension bridge. Build during 1927-1929
review: must visit place. u can see two wheelers crossing the bridge from the river.

title: nice place to visit
review: a ride of steamer boat to and fro ram jhula is a must, although not very special yet you must not miss it

title: RAM JHULA - RISHIKESH
review: There are 2 identical bridges [ Jhulas ] in Rishikesh from where you can cross the Ganges . Stunning view and you can also feel the Bridge shaking , its lot of fun, When you cross the Bridge you enter a Hippy World , full of Temples and Yoga Establishments along with  Handicraft shops . A must visit.

title: Bridges of Rishikesh
review: This bridge was built during the era of indira gandhi and this is lower in height as compared to laxman jhula. You can reach swargashram at the opposite end.

title: RISHIKESH - A SERENE DESTINATION
review: My wife and I went on a 2 day trip to Rishikesh and Haridwar in November 2014. ppy at night. We stayed in a Hotel in Rishikesh with a wonderful view of the River Ganga. We spent the morning strolling along the river. It  was a very pleasant morning and it was very peaceful early in the morning with many tourists like us just sitting around on the steps or doing yoga or meditation by the river. The sound of the fast flowing river was very peaceful.

title: pretty but crowded
review: ram jhula much busier than laxman. The bridge itself is quite pretty but can be PACKED especially on weekends. Come early, get your photo and then only use again when you need it.

title: Very crowded
review: Was quite disappointed to see motorcyclists on this bridge !! How can this be allowed?? The local authorities should do something about this.

title: Good experience but chaotic
review: The view of the Ganga ghats at rishikesh from ramjua is beautiful. However the the unregulated bike and 2 wheeler traffic on the bridge causes acute discomfort to all and sundry.

title: Beautiful
review: I like the market very busy place and the Ashram so beautiful. I like to take the taxi boat to cross the river.

title: Pleasant walk
review: Enjoyed the walk over the bridge. But the bikers plying over the bridge with their horns blasting was spoiling the mood.

title: Enjoy Your Walk
review: A walk through Ramjhula though crowded is enjoyable. But beware of Locals riding in Motor Cycles and cattles knocking you down. The walk is worth in spite of them. The view of Ghats and Ganges from the Bridge is fascinating.This bridge is constructed after independance.Once you cross the bridge there are many attractions and shops on the otherside to spensd a few hours.

title: Great structure to see
review: Unmissable on a visit to Rishikesh, the more modern Ram jhula is a great piece of technology serving local people and tourists alike. But then again it should be kept free of two wheelers to allow people to walk in peace and tourists to admire the bridge without being injured by a 2wheeler.

title: Marvel bridge
review: One of small and brilliant bridge, key place to visit at Rishikesh. This bridge makes travelling of local persons short by 7-8 Kms. Bridge is quite narrow and for walking only, but you would find 2 local persons taking 2 wheeler also on this bridge

title: Way to heavenly abode of god
review: The view is breath taking from this bridge called jhula..

title: Watch out! Don't feed the monkeys!
review: So wonderful the view of Ganga here. Beware of the monkeys, yes , they are cute and interesting but hide your food and DON'T FEED THEM? They will steal from you and possibly attack. So be careful and admire them from afar.

title: Most important
review: Liked - views from the bridge, holy baths at ghat near the bridge

title: A shaky experience.
review: This suspended bridge is a hub of activity with motorbikes , cows and people crossing overt the other side of the river banks to perform rituals , buy trinkets and treats and visit the ashrams.

title: WORTH A VISIT
review: RAM JHULA AND LAXMAN JHULA are a must do while in Rishikesh !! and cross the Ganga for the evening aarti !!

title: Rishkesh Holidays
review: Constructed after independence on same concept of Laxman Jhula. Bit wider & stronger than Laxman Jhula. Very pleasant to walk on it. Both Jhulas are prime attraction of Rishikesh & must see.

title: average.
review: just a bridge like lakshman jhula. good view of the river. but very very crowded. impossible to stand for a minute and enjoy it with all the people rushing by and two wheelers honking. a view from a distance would leave a better memory  think

title: Swaying Bridge
review: Nothing great to write about this place as it is too crowded, two wheelers crossing honking all the way which is too irritating. Though it is touted to be a attraction, the surroundings are not kept clean to make it look attractive.

title: Best transportation on water.....
review: Best transportation on water in god's own country and best way to customise visit to both river side.....

title: Nice Bridge over river Ganges connecting banks and ghats
review: This bridge is in close vicinity of Rishikesh town, connecting the Banks of Ganges river.  Breath taking view especially early morning and late evenings when the prayers (Aarti) is offered.  Evenings are lighted by flood lights on the Ghats(Banks) of Ganges.  Small shops and restaurants are lined along  the approach road.  River Ganga can be crossed by government owned boats at a nominal cost for people who do not want to cross this bridge

title: Pleasant!
review: Again, just like Laxman Jhula, this bridge is named after the great Lord Ram from the Hindu Mythology. It is one of the few 'Hanging Bridges' in India. It stretches for about 100 meters. The walk is really Pleasant here.

title: Thrilling to pass through
review: While visiting Parmath Niketan in Rishikesh one is to use the Ram Jhula to cross the Ganges. Though the passing through this hanging bridge is very thrilling but at same bikers are the great nuisance with no traffic sence at all. Management there is meek to control. Cleanliness is again the other negative to this charming place.

title: A "WOW" Factor feel place
review: It was 10 pm in night and I along with my wife through to feel the fresh air. Someone suggested us to walk over the Bridge to feel something which is out of the world. We tried and went over Ram Jhula, it was amazing experience for both of us. We stood in center of bridge to take some selfies and felt the freshness of air & water (river ganga). If you are there, then don’t forget to try this one.

title: Crowded!!!
review: The bridge, no wonder is an architectural marvel but its too crowded. Don't know why bikes and cycles are allowed on this. Just a one time visit.

title: Good place to visit when in Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is a simple old bridge to cross from one end of Rishkesh to other. The bridge itself may seem very ordinary to some, but visiting Ram Jhula means visiting the surrounding market, temples and ashrams.

title: Ram Jhula is nothing out of the ordinary
review: Ram Jhula, though has its mythological origins, currently what is standing is the iron suspension bridge and there is nothing out of the ordinary about it. Of course the launch boat srevices across tehe river is something that you can do if you have small kids. A dip in the Holy ganges, visit to Gita Bhavan and witnessing Ganga Aarti at sunset are some of the other tings that one can do when at the Ram Jhula

title: superr
review: must visit .. the experience and the breeze is so good . one must visit the Ram Jhula and the Laxman Jhula as well.the location is very scenic.

title: Awesome biking experience
review: It was a great winter afternoon to have hired a bike and cruise on ram jhula. I have visited this place both in the summers and in winters. But, I feel winters is the best time to visit this beautiful place.

title: Do visit during evening/night time
review: Visit is a must after the sunset, when weather becomes quite cool and its quite breezy, you can feel the bridge moving. Its gives you a feel as if you are on a swing.

title: Mesmerising
review: one of the most calm and scenic places visited. The view of the mountains and the ganga river is simply awesome

title: Shaky
review: Too shaky in wind.And too small for transport. On the way to ganga aarti. Must visit once. There is a good shopping market after you cross.

title: A wobbling passage to the other side
review: The bridge is really unsteady when strong winds blow. But it is a short cut to reach the other side of ganga ghat. The two wheelers should be banned on the bridge as it causes a lot of inconvenience to the pedestrians.

title: Nothing Else other than peace....!!
review: I visited Rishikesh on October.

title: Too much hype
review: The Ramjhula ( bridge) by itslef is a unique experience, as it is a swinging bridge . I felt it was too narrow to allow  motorbikes and scooters and when these came on it was not at all a pleasant walk. If the same was maintianed as a pedestrian only bridge, it would be a much more interesting experience.

title: One of the most popular bridge used by locals.
review: This bridge was built after Laxman jhula.Its width is smaller than Laxman jhula.Its mostly used by locals to reach other side of river bank,Get good view of river Ganga as you pass from this bridge,

title: its simply epic
review: Unlike Laxman Jhula which is said to be originally hung by Laxman,, Ram jhula as a later addition attracts equal amount of tourists.

title: Great view of River ganges and the hill range
review: The visit from Doiwala Dehradun to Ram Jhula opens a world of its own. The vieasws are breath-taking. The facilities are outstanding. Do take time to sit at the Public Ghats of Parmarth ashram during evening and have a view of the Aarti.

title: Awesome
review: Good place. Specially the Ganga Aarti along Triveni Ghat near Ram Jhula. Worth a visit at Rishikesh.

title: Excellent bridge over the Ganges
review: Loved this suspension bridge over the ganges and the evening Gangaes aarti across it. Ther is a nice restaurant called Choti Wala which is worth a visit.

title: Nice place
review: Love exploring this place, especially clicking the ganga river. Bit crowded but can be explored. You can reach to this place by auto from any place around Rishikesh

title: Beautiful.....better than Laxman Jhula.
review: One can walk to Ram jhula from Laxman jhula or take Auto.though the Autos usually go to Haridwar and one needs to cleary tell the driver that you need to go till Ram Jhula only.then there are 2 points of getting down....one stairs takes you near jhula and another to ferry point.but it doesn't really matter where you get down as these are interconnected,still with young kids you need to be exact.

title: great footbridge..carry spare change
review: ram jhula bridge is very similar to laxman except for no monkeys!..a lot of beggars use it so carry some spare change and help a less fortunate soul....too many motorbikes..personally they shouldnt mix motorbikes with foot traffic but hey..this is India!  Great view of the Ganges  looking south to Haridwar

title: Nice Bridge over Ganga
review: It's a bridge over ganga river. Very busy bridge , better than Laxman jhula. Must visit at night once there is no crowd and feel the cold breeze and vibration of bridge at night.

title: Beautiful!
review: Be on your gaurd ... Don't be seduced fully by the beauty and exotic sights. The monkeys are dangerous ! Do not feed them and watch your bags around them. Pick pockets are rife. Women will have a much better experience when dressed with headscarfs and covered up, will draw less negative attention. Once you cover those bases, you will experience the beauty of this place! Not too far from here is an amazing temple, not to be missed. Yogis dressed orange may allow photographs and appreciate donations. Enjoy! Don't forget to look up Children of the Ganges... A free volunteer donation run school in Rishikesh. They accept paypal online for donations. A very worthy foundation. ️

title: mast hight
review: Excellent view of river from this bridge..... long bridge but nessasary to cross because maximum attraction was other side.  Crowed areas but nice locations

title: Aarti on Parmarth is worth the travel
review: The Aarti at Parmarth is really worth the experience of travelling from the Ram Jhulla to the Parmarth. It's gives you an feeling of being with Ganga & relishing the pleasure of praying to Maa Ganga. The puja & Aarti on the steps of Ganges in the presences of Guruji takes you the highest level in belief of God.

title: increadible
review: Too high . Long bridge. Too much crowed but nessasary to cross if you want go for aarti ceremoney. Saw monkeyies over bridge. Hungry BT lovely with her child

title: Nice suspension bridge
review: We were walking distance to this lovely bridge from our hotel.

title: Run for your life.
review: Another crowded Jhula with traffic of bikes and thela's from both side. On such a narrow suspension bridge I don't know what the administration of Uttarakhand is waiting for.

title: Excellent place and Aarti
review: Great place for a nice dinner at the restaurants nearby. Also we crossed the bridge to see the famous Parmarth Niketan Ganaga Aarti. Thank god we decided on this after the disappointing Triveni  ghat aarti.

title: Good View and access to local market
review: View from Ram Jhula was not as good as it was from Laxman Jhula. It is surrounded by local market where you can roam around and shop..

title: Big (or small) bro of Laxman Jhula
review: Just like in epic Mahabharata, here Jhulas also have Ram and Laxman as brothers. Ram Jhula is also popular, but not as much as the other one. Still you will find crowds and monkeys all over the bridge.

title: Visit to see Scenic Beauty in the background
review: Its one of the few attractions which has both river and hills in the background and nature lovers would love this place

title: Ram Jhula -- Best Walking Experience
review: During my stay, I visited Ram jhula couple of times.. I will say every evening I was there on this bridge for a walk. There are many stalls nearby and it is a happening place. But I loved the walk on the bridge and enjoyed the views and the flow of Ganges. You can have tea beside this bridge or read your favourite novel on your e-reader on bank of Ganges.

title: Yay bridges
review: Lovèd it... Could spend all day watching people crossing the bridge... On bikes, scooters, foot, pushing vendor carts, children feeding fish, beggars, not to mention the dogs, monkeys and cows ....revisited each day... Also enjoyed the fact that still the Indian domestic Visitors outnumber the westerners!

title: Beautiful sunset from the bridge
review: This bridge was lovely and saw a beautiful sunset from it. Also the famous Ganges ceremony though very far from our hotel was amazing a a truly memorable experience - Nirvana. It was just a few who ventured from the group but it was truly worth it.

title: Good views
review: 1. Close to ghats on Ganges

title: nice plaace
review: best place in rishikesh for roaming around. specially afternoon time. and ladies u just love this place for shopping.

title: fun
review: The views are not as awesome as Laxmi Jhula, but still just as crazy and fun to cross and people watch.

title: Tourist spot
review: Ram Jhula built in 1986 is an iron suspension bridge over river Ganges situated at Muni Ki Reti in Rishikesh. The bridge is similar in design but bigger than the more popular Lakshman Jhula. One can get amazing view of Ganges from the jhula and click pictures of boats floating on it. There are many Hindu ashrams and religious centers like "Gita Bhawan" and "Swargashram" located close to Ram Jhula along with popular restaurants like Chotiwala. One can also enjoy boat ride from here for crossing the river.

title: Great india
review: I love this place . Very calm to walk along the river . Also parma niketan is beautiful . There are many people who want learn the yoga n meditation . This is the perfect place that I imagine about india .

title: Nice bridge..
review: This is one of the two bridges of Rishikesh. Originally, it should be just a pedestrian bridge but a lot of people drive on it with scooters and motorbikes.

title: Top Spot
review: Parts of Ram Jhula are bustling with pilgrims and tourists, parts - especially the beach - are tranquil and serene.  I love all sides of this place, both the craziness and the peace.  It is a fantastic place for people watching and photography, and invariably you will see a cow do something amusing.  For me, one of the highlights is the sunset puja, the "aarti", at Parmath Niketan.  Also you might consider walking down to "the Beatles Ashram" (as it is now called, but it was actually Maharishi Mahesh Yogi's ashram) which has now gone to ruin, in a very beautiful and poetic way.  Also, lots of yoga schools, both in Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula.  The biggest attraction of all for me, though, is the Ganga River herself... peaceful and serene, you will find yourself involuntarily hypnotised into a meditative state, either sitting at the ghats or the beach beyond the bridge.

title: Good to kill a few hours .
review: Good shopping stalls and lots of book shops. A few good juice bars here aswell. Nothing else here to rave about. I picked up a few bargains here.

title: Nice scenery - but that's all
review: If you have been to Laxman Jhula - do not waist you time. No Pujas out of season as very few people visit.

title: Great Jhula
review: One can cross River and go opposite side of Rishikesh by Ram Jhula And Laxman Jhula on feet. By vehicle u have to move in kilometers. By road from Haridwar first come Ram Jhula and then Laxman Jhula. distance between this two r aprox 4 km but you can hire taxi. Geeta Bhavan & Swarg Ashram. Much commotion here then Laxman Jhula. Must visit once in a life.

title: World Famous Ganges Aarti across the bridge
review: Another spectacular bridge a bit overcrowded than laxman Jhula. The World Famous Ganges Aarti takes place every evening across it. It is an experience to be had once in your life at least.

title: authentic bridge
review: If you are in Rishikesh, it is a classic way to use this bridge and wonder arround. Good architecture but be carefull while walking. It is generally so crowded and full of people.

title: beware of monkeys
review: ramjhula is a great bridge,an attraction of tourist.but it has lots of monkeys.do not try to eat something at the bridge as they will snatch your food.no one take action for that but overall great bridge and try to sit in boat one time.you can go one time from bridge and after coming back come from boat.do remember there r boat timing.u will nt get boat at the time of sunset.

title: Part of your fun trip
review: you have to start or end your trip doing ram or Laxman Jhula. It is so much fun to do it. You see ppl doing River Rafting from top. Water running through mountains. Both side of Ganga you see ashrams or some old houses or temples or people worshipping Ganga as a part of ritual which a nice site to watch. One must do ram Jhula to witness all of it.

title: Famouse in Rushikesh
review: All people of India known of Bhagwan Shri Ram. This jhula is known as a Ram Jhula. Every people who visit Rushikesh muse visit Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula. This jhula is a very old.

title: Hanging Bridge at Rishikesh
review: Ram Jhula is before Lakshman Jhula. while you travel on the hanging bridge you can swing while you walk along.

title: Very good
review: Liked this spot and recommend it for all you shoppers. It is filled with the sights, smells, and goodies, trinkets, etc. you could ever want. the shop owners are friendly and willing to discount. It is a very friendly place to visit and feels safe.

title: Rishikesh Temples
review: Very close to Laxman Jhula , Ram Jhula is also located in Rishikesh. While one takes holy dip in Ganges water at Haridwar ,apart from Mansa Devi Temple , one can visit Ram Jhula & Laxman Jhula. Nice bridge , good well maintained river bed , good ambience , good souvenir shops with gem stone studded rings or chain are added attractions at Rishikesh. In one visit , one can visit many temples around within striking distance. Recommended.

title: Yoga, Ashram and backpackers
review: This place full of backpackers who stay in any small ashram near Ram Jhula. Best place for yoga, quiet no body bother you, except babas who beg to feed them or smoke weed with them.

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Its another hanging bridge connecting the temples with the main road but this one is bigger than Laxman Jhula. When you walk on this bridge, you could feel the swing since its suspended with iron cables. Need maintenance and 2 wheeler restriction.

title: Try at middle of the bridge
review: Connecting Rope bridge between Swargashram, Gita Bhawan and other temples with Rishikesh.  this bridge is bigger than Lakshman Jhula . When u stand on it in the middle of the bridge u get coool breeze and looking down to ganga, gives optical illusion as if we are moving over it.

title: Very crowded
review: The pathway was absolutely jam packed. On top of that, two wheelers were allowed to ply. It was not a great experience walking along it.

title: Same like Laxman Jhula
review: Ram Jhula is a replica of Laxman Jhula, again a very crowded hanging bridge. Bikers create a nuisance here and don't allow to stand and enjoy the view peacefully.

title: Hanging Bridge in Rishikesh
review: It's something like you are in heaven , on top of Ganga while crossing the picture you can take beautiful picture , it's a holy and little crowed every time ! If one visiting Rishikesh this is the must to visit , there are lot of small shops where you can buy lot of beautiful painting , indian crafts and many more , you also can participate in Aarti , meditation and free yoga classes near by

title: Soak in the spiritual vibes
review: Time slows here and it is a great experience for religious and non-religious people. Enjoy a dip in the holy Ganga river and exprience life here. I guess the Ganga Aarti purifies the atmosphere and it just feels so good here!

title: A tourist place in Rishikesh
review: A large Cantilever bridge across Ganges in Rishikesh, used by pedestrian traffic to cross to the side where Ashrams & Geeta Bhawan are located. Much care for housekeeping is required to attract Tourists from abroad.

title: The Hanging Bridge
review: The "Hanging Bridge" across the river Ganga is called the Ram Jhula and and is used heavily by both the locals and the tourists as a means to cross over to the other side of the river.It can be very traumatising as there is a constant movement of motor bikes crossing to either side of the river at the same time as the pedestrians.

title: Rishikesh visit
review: I liked the scenery and the mountains, river and a quiet place.

title: Rustic popular hanging bridge
review: Ram Jhula is the ONLY passage from Rishikesh to the village of Ram Jhula, save the ferry. As such, it is often crowded, but an experience to ground you in the simple life of the spiritual sites. Nothing fancy to distract you from the purpose, to bask in the presence of the Ganga, and the temples there celebrating her sacred flow, and the sudden height and presence of the Himalayas as the backdrop. One of my number 1 travel choices.Ann G.

title: Better and bigger version of Lakshman Jhula
review: Like its sibling, Lakshman Jhula, Ram Jhula is a relatively new addition to Rishikesh. It was built in 1980s and is bigger than the Lakshman Jhula, though both are built using same technology, cable suspended bridge. If you do not want to cross over Ganga via this bridge then you can opt for river boats which ply down the bridge near the car parking area. However these boats ply till the sunset so if you want to cross the river after that time then this bridge is the only option. Mind that this is not a pedestrian bridge, so you will encounter bikes and cycles as your co-travelers. Do not miss Chotiwala which is situated in the Ram Jhula parking area. Overall, if you opting for this bridge, then it would be a nice experience for small kids, and can also be used as a good photographic location.

title: Jhula with great view
review: I was standing at the  middle Ramjhula on full moon day i.e, on 7th Oct and enjoyed the beauty of the nature with Gangaji arround 10pm. Just awesome !!!

title: Utimate View of river ganga
review: Ram Jhula, is place to visit at Rishikesh trip - a place better managed as compared to Lakshman Jhula, nice view - we clicked some wonderful pictures on the Jhula itself, enjoyed the sand beach of river Ganga - water is very clear at this place and also enjoyed the boating - crossing back the river.

title: Loved the atmosphere
review: Loved Chatawalas for a lovely espresso and the whole atmosphere of Ram Jhula, the market and Swarg Ashram.

title: Good view but over crowded..
review: The Ram Jhula is a hanging bridge that connects main Rishikesh city to Swargashram area for bikes and pedestrians. The area has many Ashrams and small shops. There are very few restaurants around. The area is dirty with cow dungs and other trash. The area below the bridge needs cleanup.

title: Good bridge but with the usual problems like Laxman Jhula
review: It is another bridge built more recently and nearer to rishikesh compared to Laxman Jhula. It is also known as Sivananda Pul (Bridge) as it is accessible very near the Sivananda Ashram. It is good for crossing over to the Swargashram side but again, look out for 2-wheelers honking and merrily driving on the narrow bridge. The authorities should construct one more bridge for 2-wheelers so that pedestrians can finally walk in peace.

title: AwESOME walk on the Bridge.
review: Enjoyed a walk over the bridge which connects tapovan to main rishikesh city. It gives not only a spectacular view but the freeze from the Ganges just touches your soul.

title: Good experience but too much crowded.
review: One must enjoy the swings and the long span of the hanging bridge which will describe its quality itself.

title: Diminishing Beauty
review: I have been to this place at least 30 years ago, when it was a serene, uncrowded place and had a real holy ambiance.

title: ANOTHER GREAT SWING
review: Just before the kawar mela, passing through the busy street comes the jhulla, now the administration has put in two pole barrier, maybe to stop the two wheelers from plying on the  bridge, it will be a good idea to ban two wheelers on the bridge, great cool breeze on the jhulla is mindblowing.

title: Jai Shree Ram
review: This bridge is more crowded and there was a little further from our hotel! But to walk on it you have to! Be sure to meet some brazen monkeys and probably more cows that sprawling imposingly in the center of the bridge !! By the way I advise everyone to look at his feet, and then the cow poop there too much, you can plunge

title: Nice place visit.
review: I born in this area.

title: lots of street stalls
review: There were lots of street stalls and that is where you can catch a tuk tuk or a taxi. Not as nice as Laxman Jhula.

title: good one
review: good tourist place made of steel rope.good to see.

title: nothing much..
review: too much rush and transports vehicles also coming through this leads to chaos..not very different from laxman jhula.

title: Same as Lakshman Jhula
review: Leads to Gita Bhawan & Parmarth Niketan. Same problem of two wheelers that is really disturbing. Good eating joints.

title: no more swinging
review: it is no more that care free feeling.

title: Mythical hype--but used like an ordinary transport bridge !
review: This chain/rope bridge is meant for pedestrians, but two-wheelers use this so much as to make it scary and difficult for pedestrians ! The view of the Ganges from both sides of the ropeway bridge is brilliant !

title: Hanging rope bridge
review: This chain/rope bridge is meant for pedestrians, but two-wheelers use this so much as to make it scary and difficult for pedestrians.  When I returned there Ganges is excessive. Ram Jula has Mythical hype--but used like an ordinary transport bridge

title: Bustling place
review: We got our of our rafting gear at this place and wandered around the same after that. The place has a unique charm and is surrounded by many ashrams and agents for rafting and promoting various adventure sports. Try a grub at Flavors hotel nearby adjoining the rickshaw stand.

title: Spiritual center
review: I have been visiting Ram Jhula since many years and love the Ganga aarti around this area. Do visit if you come to Rishikesh and also buy some kurtas.

title: Shaking, beautiful Ram Jhula.
review: Its an experience. Beautiful bridge, View is awesome and spiritually inspiring at evening time around 5pm-9pm. Whole bridge made of metal.First foot I put there and I was shaking and feeling the groove. Cow was also present on the bridge, was sitting and I guess was taking a sun bath. Few children were asking us to feed the fishes which we obliged and had fun. You can see big fishes from the bridge. Bike were moving, people were moving, ganges water was flowing, felt good.

title: Good view of the river
review: Nice to see this huge rope bridge connecting both the banks of Ganga river. Offers an excellent view of the river as well as Ghats on both the sides. They have however allowed two wheelers to cross over Ram Jhula and that is a nuisance because every now and then somebody is honking behind you. Overall, its fine.

title: Engineering Masterpiece
review: Being an engineer its my duty to see the technical aspects of anything i visit..and dis ram jhula holds a special status for me..nt only bcoz of its excellent engg. bt for its mythological importance too.. a perfect Mytho-Techno combo.

title: unrepaired after the floods
review: Beauty of Ganga can be felt from this hanging bridge, it is so awesome to stand on it and 'feel' the breeze flowing over the sacred river. It requires immediate attention and repair as it is developing cracks & holes.

title: an unique experience in Rishikesh
review: An unique experience while in Rishikesh! the views to the Ganga are awesome, the cafes, restaurants and shops on both sides are good and to be able to stroll on the streets of Rishikesh amongst local people, cows, the sounds of the bells of the temples - there is everything to everybody in here. Don't forget your camera!

title: Unable to enjoy due to dangerous two wheeler traffic
review: i recently visited Rishikesh and made an offering to the River Ganges. We "strolled" across the bridge to view from the middle and  had difficulty walking due to the constant two wheeler traffic.I had to adhere to the sides to avoid being hit by motor scooters which constantly sped by. The scooter traffic ruins the experience. No lighting was available on the bridge. It was just after dusk.  A highlight of the experience was, seemingly, out of no where, a very young girl appeared out of the dark in front of me and said "namaste." She disappeared just as quickly as she appeared.

title: better view from ram jhula.
review: the view is better  from the ram  jhula than it's older though younger sibling laxman jhula. a good walk ; cross from ram jhula ,go left towards laxman jhula cross over and come back to ram jhula. you have seen and felt rishikesh. do it once clockwise  and next day   do it anti clockwise. nice walk.

title: Crossing the "Bridge"
review: Like Laxhman Jhula there is so much to see and do in this area, great food and book shops, interesting people, walking across the bridge at night (especially on full moon) is epic with all the people performing their evening worship on the ghats of the Ganga, taking the ferry across is also fun!

title: Like Laxman Jhula but without the charm
review: Ram Jhula is like Laxman Jhula about 1km away, but without the atmosphere. The railing is too high and the views are kind of desolate. If you can only see one, stick to Laxman Jhula at sunrise :) !

title: Ramjhula Bridge...
review: Rishikesh is a nice  place in Uttarakhand, i visit there with my some friends, the Ram Jhulla Bridge is a great bridge since many years. Nice place.

title: its another bridge!
review: it's another bridge you walk across in 5 minutes.  about 2/3 of the way across there is always a big shoal of huge fish below with kids selling you fish food.

title: Tourist trap
review: So much for spirituality.  I came here after Laxman Jhula and the difference was night and day.  To me it was the difference between living spiritually vs selling it.

title: grand View
review: Ram Jula and Laxman Jula Both are just hanging rope bridge. When I returned there Ganges is excessive. At this point it is very nice to see the river from the highest bridge.

title: Nothing Special
review: Both Lakshman and Ram Jhula's are simple rope hanging bridges. It's history could be good to hear---that's all. However, for those unaware, make a trip thru' Ram jhula to the PARAMARTHA Ghat in the evening. The Arati hear is excellent experience. Very colorful and very orthodox--far better than Triveni Ghat.

title: Excellent
review: When I gone there Ganga is overflowing. At that time it is very nice to see the river over the tallest bridge. Both are just rope hanging bridge. If you are the lover of nature, you will really enjoy it.

title: Great, Very scenic!!!!!
review: You get awesome feeling at Ram Jhula, very pure, scenic clean and serene. Lovely spiritual place.  If you are in Rishikesh, Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula are main attractions, and are must see. Both are equally beautiful.

title: ramjhula
review: sheer size and the flow of water keeps you mesmerized... the walk over the bridge transports you to the other side of chants and bhajans

title: Ritual on this side
review: On this side of the river is possible to watch a very traditional ritual to the ganga river everyday on the afternoon near 18 o'clock ... there are very good restaurants all around!

title: ram Jhula
review: Is a bridge similar to Lakshman Jhula also spanning the river Ganges .You can feel the bridge sway when the wind is heavy . Close to all the temples and accomodation areas .

title: Ram Jhula
review: This Jhula is also overcrowded and walking in comfort is not possible. The distance between the Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula can be covered by private vehicle. You can take some rest in the garden before getting on to the bridge.

title: Unique experience
review: Ram Jhula is truely big and unique of its kind. Used by pedestrians and two wheelers, the bridge is always crowded. With mighty Ganga flowing below and beautiful view around, practically almost every tourist takes a moment to stop here and take a few snaps here inspite of all the crowd.

title: A Suspension Bridge
review: It is a suspension bridge constructed on the Ganga River in the 1980s... It can be also be used by vehicles unlike the Laxman Jhula. Apparently during the recent Uttarakhand floods, it sustained some damage and the vehicular traffic on it was restricted when I last saw.

title: GOO PLACE TO VISIT AND GET FEEL FOR AREA
review: Must go over this bridge and experience looking out on ganges. good walk on the way to arathi at parnathan niketan.many shops before and after bridge.

title: An architectural marvel
review: The best part of Ram Jhula is when you stand in the middle of the bridge, almost in the center of Ganga ji. The view then is amazing on both side and the breeze is almost addictive.

title: Don't get confused with Laxman Jhoola
review: Don't get confused on this with Laxman Jhoola. Ram Jhoola was built after Laxman Jhoola. However, it's cleaner and newer than the Laxman Jhoola and this place has more places to eat and stay.

title: Excellent
review: Ganga Beach was awesome, we really spent some quality life under the Ramjhoola near Ganga river beach.

title: Nice Place......
review: Nice place for visit and very peaceful area.... giving food to the fishes from Ram jhula is good experiance........

title: Quite a walk on the bridge..!!
review: Well..this bridge is held by metal wires pinned on both sides of the ganges ghat. There is no pillar in between to support it. Thus while crossing it if there is a wind blowing the bridge will shake and give you the chills..!! At night it is more fun, cause there is darkness all around and the wind will howl and make the bridge shake..!! This was built for people to cross, but nowdays 2-wheelers are also using it. Gives one an unending view of the Ganges and the ghats..!!

title: Leading to the biggest Ashram
review: We crossed this beautiful bridge to get to the Ashram for Ganga Aarti. Just on the other side the places are full with shops and different sellers of everything. Very touristic.

title: Let us not give safety a miss
review: The Ram Jhula at Rishikesh is an attractive place ,but the traffic on the Jhula is totally uncontrolled. One has to take care of himself.The Ghat also requires cleaning and maintenance.

title: The 2nd swaying bridge
review: This one is named after Lord Ram.Is almost similar to the Laxman Jhula.A oone time but beware of the monkeys they snatch food material away from you.

title: a good walk from side to side
review: The bridge is quite busy, so if you don't wanna get bumped, honked or touched, don't bother!

title: Engineering Marvel
review: Being a engineer this was my first cable stayed bridge seen in my life. the bridge shake due to foot fall of people on the bridge. and the valley where the bridge is full of noise due to flow of Ganga river.

title: brilliant
review: Well..this bridge is held by metal wires pinned on both sides of the ganges ghat. There is no pillar in between to support it. Thus while crossing it if there is a wind blowing the bridge will shake and give you the chills..!! At night it is more fun, cause there is darkness all around and the wind will howl...

title: Sight to see
review: The aarthy place is a sight to see. One must be around and witness aarthy. One has to walk a couple of KMs to reach the aarthy sight. It is something one must see in the evening. The aarthy time is 5.40pm.

title: Pathetic
review: You actually don't get to enjoy the walk across the bridge, with somany people walking, beggers siting, bikes, scooters and animals crossing at the same time.

title: Walking along Ram Jhula, Rishikesh
review: It was a nice experience walking along Ram Jhula in Rishikesh. It is a beautiful suspension bridge and walking along it gives one great pleasure.

title: Nice walk on Ram Jhula
review: It was nice to walk on Ram Jhula and cross Ganga. The views from Ram Jhula are wonderful. After a brief visit to the Ashrams and temples nearby,  it was pleasant to come back by boat and have a holy dip in Ganga.

title: Twin of laxmanjhula....
review: Ramjhula is nothing but the xerox copy of laxmanjhula except few things...it is also a suspension bridge situated across ganga and comes after laxmanjhula as ganga descends from mountain...it appeared a bit more long than laxmanjhula to me...now the difference is that it is not at all crowded compared to laxmanjhula...temples, market place etc like laxmanjhula are absent here...the path from road to the bridge is not so good...as it is not very crowded you can walk, stand freely on the bridge...we didnt spend much time here, not even cross the bridge because it was almost dusk then...we took some snaps, felt the breeze standing on the bridge and then came back as early as possible...if you are short of time can avoid it otherwise go for it...

title: Street Shopping
review: Shop along the street with cows, goats and donkeys for shawls, bags, clothes. Drink freshly squeezed sugar cane juice.

title: Must visit for view and Photography
review: Good place for Photography.

title: Amazing Ram Jhula!!
review: One of the best attraction of Rishikesh..longest among the two (other one is Laxman jhula).. excellent view of holy Ganges and the mountains.. truly scenic and a very good place for photography also..totally enjoyed!!

title: ram jhula
review: it is situated at haridwar. it connect the two sides of river. nice view from center point. good view of different temples and city.

title: Walking the bridge in the dark.
review: I walked Ram Jhula in the nite.The experience was awesome.It was after dark in the evening as i was walking the dark  lanes towards the bridge,faint music playing on one of the shops probably the name was bhajan sangam playing the track om shiva shambo got instilled in my mind,the ganga was flowing silently under the bridge,cool air blowing on my face,the lights of the shops reflecting on the ganga,there was giggling & laughter every where,saw some saadhus reachin the 7th heaven with their marijuana. Wow,it was like a walking meditation.Visited this place every year but every time it feels like i have been there for the first time. such is the freshness of this place.The traders association can do something better to keep clean the lanes 'cause there was a slight irritating smell the entire lane.But once u climb up on the bridge it's only fresh air nothing else matters.

title: one time visit if u r headed for foor , great pics and chotiwala and aarti
review: just the cows and monkeys create neusence rest is  ok , try chotiwala food nearby  on the second one from jhula the best one , and  watch aarti at swarg ashram just for one time , rest is basic

title: a nice walk in the evening
review: ram jhula surrounded by markets is a good place to take a stroll in the evening and go on shopping spree. It is a thrilling experience walking on the ram jhula rope bridge. Ram jhula is the link that connects two sides of the river crossing which you can go to Parmarth Niketan and Chotiwala restaurant

title: Crowded, 2-wheelers, and cows...
review: Same as Lakshman Jhula... Ram Jhula is crowded and there are too many 2-wheelers which constantly keep blaring their horns. You cannot really enjoy the views. Again, better to see it from the outside, since its pain walking over it with all the crowd and the traffic.

title: Like Laxman...
review: Just even more crowded, if that were possible. If you are here in the yatra season, it's completely overrun. But again, sweeping views of the Mighty Ganga.

title: Evening Treat
review: the boat ride across the ganges for the evening aarti is a must, thr roadside mehendi artists and the walk across the ram jhula was cool and refreshing

title: Sit by the Ganga
review: Sit on the ghat, enjoy the breeze, look at the waters flowing swiftly by and just chill. You will feel a sense of serenity automatically descending on you. It's a wonderful feeling. You can also take a boat ride across the river and walk down to the Mahesh Yogi ashram where the Beatles stayed for a few weeks. That's also quite an experience.

title: Great View from A Narrow Suspension Bridge
review: Very important and ancient suspension bridge to cross river Ganga afoot. Motor-Bikes, scooters and pedal rickshaws are permitted to use this extremely narrow bridge, making it a nightmare for pedestrians to walk along. A ferry service available at the foot of the bridge is cheap, speedy and comfortable. The view of the grand and pious river Ganga from Raam Jhula is worth all the trouble to cross on the bridge. Very old and Important Ashrams and Temples are located on one side and Rishikesh city, some commercial establishments, Sivananda Hospital and few important Ashrams like Sivananda Ashram are all located on the other side; hence the traffic crossing across the river is ever increasing.

title: Another Bridge
review: Yes that's right, it's a bridge. A suspension bridge. A suspension bridge that goes from one side of the Ganges river to the other. Yip, it's s bridge.

title: Love it awesome place
review: I like this jhula of the Rishikesh which you have come once in a year and see the many people moving here and there with full enjoyment and it's family very happy.

title: A swinging affair
review: A pleasant experience. The walk on the bridge flanked by the Holy waters on both sides and the scenic view is breathtaking.

title: Worth a visit
review: There is very little to do around the bridge, which itself is a relatively modern "suspended bridge" construction, built and maintained by the Government.

title: Vacation time
review: Awesome Place for peace of mind. Every evening you can watch and take part in famous Ganga Aarti. You can relax on the banks of Ganga and take a dip in it. Must visit place of everyone. Ram Jhula is an iron suspension bridge across the river Ganga. There are many ashrams and religious centers established at both sides of the Ganges to pray and stay for pilgrims visiting the place.

title: Very good location
review: The place is very beautiful & very lovely there is so many  places to visit and see many things .

title: Wonderful
review: Ram jhula is a sort of landmark of Rishikesh and is used as a proverbial location map for ashramas , great views and temples . It's a cantilever bridge separating the two banks of Ganga river. The views in the evening with lights is worth every penny . Great views of the beautiful Ganga can be seen from this historic vantage point . Mostly crowded at any point of time of the day

title: Awesome
review: An awesome visit to Laxman Zhoola to cross the Ganges to visit temples on other side such as Geeta Bhawan or any Ashram.

title: Another Bridge
review: Yes that's right, it's a bridge. A suspension bridge. A suspension bridge that goes from one side of the Ganges river to the other. Yip, it's s bridge.

review: Awesome Place for peace of mind. Every evening you can watch and take part in famous Ganga Aarti. You can relax on the banks of Ganga and take a dip in it. Must visit place of everyone. Ram Jhula is an iron suspension bridge across the river Ganga. There are many ashrams and religious centers established at both sides of the Ganges to pray and stay for pilgrims visiting the place.

title: Worth a visit
review: There is very little to do around the bridge, which itself is a relatively modern "suspended bridge" construction, built and maintained by the Government.

title: Very good location
review: The place is very beautiful & very lovely there is so many  places to visit and see many things .

title: Awesome
review: An awesome visit to Laxman Zhoola to cross the Ganges to visit temples on other side such as Geeta Bhawan or any Ashram.

title: Wonderful
review: Ram jhula is a sort of landmark of Rishikesh and is used as a proverbial location map for ashramas , great views and temples . It's a cantilever bridge separating the two banks of Ganga river. The views in the evening with lights is worth every penny . Great views of the beautiful Ganga can be seen from this historic vantage point . Mostly crowded at any point of time of the day

title: Another Bridge
review: Yes that's right, it's a bridge. A suspension bridge. A suspension bridge that goes from one side of the Ganges river to the other. Yip, it's s bridge.

title: Sit by the Ganga
review: Sit on the ghat, enjoy the breeze, look at the waters flowing swiftly by and just chill. You will feel a sense of serenity automatically descending on you. It's a wonderful feeling. You can also take a boat ride across the river and walk down to the Mahesh Yogi ashram where the Beatles stayed for a few weeks. That's also quite an experience.

title: Great View from A Narrow Suspension Bridge
review: Very important and ancient suspension bridge to cross river Ganga afoot. Motor-Bikes, scooters and pedal rickshaws are permitted to use this extremely narrow bridge, making it a nightmare for pedestrians to walk along. A ferry service available at the foot of the bridge is cheap, speedy and comfortable. The view of the grand and pious river Ganga from Raam Jhula is worth all the trouble to cross on the bridge. Very old and Important Ashrams and Temples are located on one side and Rishikesh city, some commercial establishments, Sivananda Hospital and few important Ashrams like Sivananda Ashram are all located on the other side; hence the traffic crossing across the river is ever increasing.

title: Love it awesome place
review: I like this jhula of the Rishikesh which you have come once in a year and see the many people moving here and there with full enjoyment and it's family very happy.
